conditions.name: Has AI
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity has AI.
conditions.examples: target entity has ai

conditions.name: Alphanumeric
conditions.description: Checks if the given string is alphanumeric.
conditions.examples:
if the argument is not alphanumeric:
	send "Invalid name!"

conditions.name: Do Respawn Anchors Work
conditions.description: Checks whether or not respawn anchors work in a world.
conditions.examples: respawn anchors work in world "world_nether"

conditions.name: Event Cancelled
conditions.description: Checks whether or not the event is cancelled.

conditions.name: Can Fly
conditions.description: Whether a player is allowed to fly.
conditions.examples: player can fly

conditions.name: Can Hold
conditions.description: Tests whether a player or a chest can hold the given item.
conditions.examples:
block can hold 200 cobblestone
player has enough space for 64 feathers

conditions.name: Can See
conditions.description: Checks whether the given players can see another players.
conditions.examples:
if the player can't see the player-argument:
	message "<light red>The player %player-argument% is not online!"

conditions.name: Chance
conditions.description:
A condition that randomly succeeds or fails.
Valid values are between 0% and 100%, or if the percent sign is omitted between 0 and 1.
conditions.examples:
chance of 50%:
	drop a diamond
chance of {chance}% # {chance} between 0 and 100
chance of {chance} # {chance} between 0 and 1

conditions.name: Comparison
conditions.description: A very general condition, it simply compares two values. Usually you can only compare for equality (e.g. block is/isn't of <type>), but some values can also be compared using greater than/less than. In that case you can also test for whether an object is between two others. Note: This is the only element where not all patterns are shown. It has actually another two sets of similar patters, but with (was|were) or will be instead of (is|are) respectively, which check different time states of the first expression.
conditions.examples:
the clicked block is a stone slab or a double stone slab
time in the player's world is greater than 8:00
the creature is not an enderman or an ender dragon
patterns: (1¦neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|2¦(n't| not|4¦ neither)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\>=) %objects%
(1¦neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|2¦(n't| not|4¦ neither)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\<=) %objects%
(1¦neither|) %objects@-1% (was|were)(|2¦(n't| not|4¦ neither)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(1¦neither|) %objects@-1% (was|were)(|2¦(n't| not|4¦ neither)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(1¦neither|) %objects@1% (will be|2¦(will (not|4¦neither) be|won't be)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(1¦neither|) %objects@1% (will be|2¦(will (not|4¦neither) be|won't be)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%

conditions.name: Contains
conditions.description: Checks whether an inventory contains an item, a text contains another piece of text, or a list (e.g. {list variable::*} or 'drops') contains another object.
conditions.examples:
block contains 20 cobblestone
player has 4 flint and 2 iron ingots
{list::*} contains 5

conditions.name: Damage Cause
conditions.description: Tests what kind of damage caused a damage event. Refer to the Damage Cause type for a list of all possible causes.
conditions.examples:
# make players use their potions of fire resistance whenever they take any kind of fire damage
on damage:
	damage was caused by lava, fire or burning
	victim is a player
	victim has a potion of fire resistance
	cancel event
	apply fire resistance to the victim for 30 seconds
	remove 1 potion of fire resistance from the victim
# prevent mobs from dropping items under certain circumstances
on death:
	entity is not a player
	damage wasn't caused by a block explosion, an attack, a projectile, a potion, fire, burning, thorns or poison
	clear drops

conditions.name: Time
conditions.description: Tests whether a given real time was more or less than some time span ago.
conditions.examples:
command /command-with-cooldown:
	trigger:
		{command::%player's uuid%::last-usage} was less than a minute ago:
			message "Please wait a minute between uses of this command."
			stop
		set {command::%player's uuid%::last-usage} to now
		# ... actual command trigger here ...

conditions.name: Entity is in Liquid
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is in rain, lava, water or a bubble column.

conditions.name: Entity is Wet
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is wet or not (in water, rain or a bubble column).
conditions.examples: if player is wet:

conditions.name: Has Client Weather
conditions.description: Checks whether the given players have a custom client weather
conditions.examples:
if the player has custom weather:
	message "Your custom weather is %player's weather%"

conditions.name: Has Custom Model Data
conditions.description: Check if an item has a custom model data tag
conditions.examples: player's tool has custom model data

conditions.name: Has Metadata
conditions.description: Checks whether a metadata holder has a metadata tag.
conditions.examples: if player has metadata value "healer":

conditions.name: Has Potion
conditions.description: Checks whether the given living entities have specific potion effects.

conditions.name: Has Resource Pack
conditions.description: Checks whether the given players have a server resource pack loaded. Please note that this can't detect player's own resource pack, only the resource pack that sent by the server.
conditions.examples: if the player has a resource pack loaded:

conditions.name: Has Scoreboard Tag
conditions.description: Checks whether the given entities has the given scoreboard tags.
conditions.examples: if the targeted armor stand has the scoreboard tag "test tag":

conditions.name: Ignition Process
conditions.description: Checks if a creeper is going to explode.

conditions.name: Is Incendiary
conditions.description: Checks if an entity will create fire when it explodes. This condition is also usable in an explosion prime event.
patterns: %entities% ((is not|are not|isn't|aren't) incendiary|(does not|do not|doesn't|don't) cause[s] a[n] (incendiary|fiery) explosion)

conditions.name: Is Alive
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is alive. Works for non-living entities too.

conditions.name: Is Banned
conditions.description: Checks whether a player or IP is banned.
conditions.examples:
player is banned
victim is not IP-banned
"127.0.0.1" is banned

conditions.name: Is Block
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is a block.
conditions.examples:
player's held item is a block
{list::*} are blocks

conditions.name: Is Blocking
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is blocking with their shield.
conditions.examples:
on damage of player:
	victim is blocking
	damage attacker by 0.5 hearts

conditions.name: Is Block Redstone Powered
conditions.description: Checks if a block is indirectly or directly powered by redstone

conditions.name: Is Burning
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is on fire, e.g. a zombie due to being in sunlight, or any entity after falling into lava.
conditions.examples:
# increased attack against burning targets
victim is burning:
	increase damage by 2

conditions.name: Is Charged
conditions.description: Checks if a creeper is charged (powered).
conditions.examples:
if the last spawned creeper is charged:
	broadcast "A charged creeper is at %location of last spawned creeper%"

conditions.name: Is Climbing
conditions.description: Whether a living entity is climbing, such as a spider up a wall or a player on a ladder.
conditions.examples:
spawn a spider at location of spawn
wait a second
if the last spawned spider is climbing:
	message"The spider is now climbing!"

conditions.name: Is Edible
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is edible.
conditions.examples:
steak is edible
player's tool is edible

conditions.name: Is Empty
conditions.description: Checks whether an inventory, an inventory slot, or a text is empty.
conditions.examples: player's inventory is empty

conditions.name: Is Enchanted
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is enchanted.
conditions.examples:
tool of the player is enchanted with efficiency 2
helm, chestplate, leggings or boots are enchanted

conditions.name: Is Flammable
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is flammable.
conditions.examples:
wood is flammable
player's tool is flammable

conditions.name: Is Flying
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is flying.
conditions.examples: player is not flying

conditions.name: Is Frozen
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is frozen.
conditions.examples:
if player is frozen:
	kill player

conditions.name: Is Fuel
conditions.description: Checks whether an item can be used as fuel in a furnace.
conditions.examples:
on right click on furnace:
	if player's tool is not fuel:
		send "Please hold a valid fuel item in your hand"
		cancel event

conditions.name: Is Gliding
conditions.description: Checks whether a living entity is gliding.
conditions.examples: if player is gliding

conditions.name: Is Interactable
conditions.description: Checks wether or not a block is interactable.
conditions.examples:
on block break:
	if event-block is interactable:
		cancel event
		send "You cannot break interactable blocks!"

conditions.name: Is Invisible
conditions.description: Checks whether a living entity is invisible.
conditions.examples: target entity is invisible

conditions.name: Is Invulnerable
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is invulnerable.
conditions.examples: target entity is invulnerable

conditions.name: Is Loaded
conditions.description: Checks whether or not a chunk/world is loaded. 'chunk at 1, 1' uses chunk coords, which are location coords divided by 16.

conditions.name: Is Occluding
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is a block and completely blocks vision.
conditions.examples: player's tool is occluding

conditions.name: Is of Type
conditions.description: Checks whether an item of an entity is of the given type. This is mostly useful for variables, as you can use the general 'is' condition otherwise (e.g. 'victim is a creeper').
conditions.examples:
tool is of type {selected type}
victim is of type {villager type}

conditions.name: Is on Ground
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is on ground.
conditions.examples: player is not on ground

conditions.name: Is Online
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is online.
conditions.examples:
player is online
player-argument is offline

conditions.name: Is Operator
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is a server operator.
conditions.examples: player is an operator

conditions.name: Is Passable
conditions.description:
Checks whether a block is passable.
A block is passable if it has no colliding parts that would prevent players from moving through it.
Blocks like tall grass, flowers, signs, etc. are passable, but open doors, fence gates, trap doors, etc. are not because they still have parts that can be collided with.
conditions.examples: if player's targeted block is passable

conditions.name: Is Plugin Enabled
conditions.description:
Check if a plugin is enabled/disabled on the server.
Plugin names can be found in the plugin's 'plugin.yml' file or by using the '/plugins' command, they are NOT the name of the plugin's jar file.
When checking if a plugin is not enabled, this will return true if the plugin is either disabled or not on the server. 
When checking if a plugin is disabled, this will return true if the plugin is on the server and is disabled.

conditions.name: Is Poisoned
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is poisoned.
conditions.examples:
player is poisoned:
	cure the player from poison
	message "You have been cured!"

conditions.name: Is Preferred Tool
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is the preferred tool for a block. A preferred tool is one that will drop the block's item when used. For example, a wooden pickaxe is a preferred tool for grass and stone blocks, but not for iron ore.

conditions.name: Is Riding
conditions.description: Tests whether an entity is riding another or is in a vehicle.
conditions.examples: player is riding a saddled pig

conditions.name: Is Riptiding
conditions.description: Checks to see if an entity is currently using the Riptide enchantment.
conditions.examples: target entity is riptiding

conditions.name: Exists/Is Set
conditions.description: Checks whether a given expression or variable is set.
conditions.examples:
{teams::%player's uuid%::preferred-team} is not set
on damage:
	projectile exists
	broadcast "%attacker% used a %projectile% to attack %victim%!"

conditions.name: Is Silent
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity is silent i.e. its sounds are disabled.
conditions.examples: target entity is silent

conditions.name: Is a Skript command
conditions.description: Checks whether a command/string is a custom Skript command.
conditions.examples:
# Example 1
on command:
	command is a skript command

# Example 2
"sometext" is a skript command

conditions.name: Is Sleeping
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is sleeping.
conditions.examples:
# cut your enemies' throats in their sleep >=)
on attack:
	attacker is holding a sword
	victim is sleeping
	increase the damage by 1000

conditions.name: Is Slime Chunk
conditions.description: Tests whether a chunk is a so-called slime chunk. Slimes can generally spawn in the swamp biome and in slime chunks. For more info, see the Minecraft wiki.

conditions.name: Is Sneaking
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is sneaking.
conditions.examples:
# prevent mobs from seeing sneaking players if they are at least 4 meters apart
on target:
	target is sneaking
	distance of target and the entity is bigger than 4
	cancel the event

conditions.name: Is Solid
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is solid.
conditions.examples:
grass block is solid
player's tool isn't solid

conditions.name: Is Sprinting
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is sprinting.
conditions.examples: player is not sprinting

conditions.name: Is Stackable
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is stackable.
conditions.examples:
diamond axe is stackable
birch wood is stackable
torch is stackable

conditions.name: Is Swimming
conditions.description: Checks whether a living entity is swimming.
conditions.examples: player is swimming

conditions.name: Is Tameable
conditions.description: Check if an entity is tameable.

conditions.name: Is Transparent
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is transparent. Note that this condition may not work for all blocks, due to the transparency list used by Spigot not being completely accurate.
conditions.examples: player's tool is transparent.

conditions.name: Is Unbreakable
conditions.description: Checks whether an item is unbreakable.
conditions.examples: if event-item is unbreakable

conditions.name: Is Valid
conditions.description: Checks whether an entity has died or been despawned for some other reason.
conditions.examples: if event-entity is valid

conditions.name: Is Normalized
conditions.description: Checks whether a vector is normalized i.e. length of 1
conditions.examples: vector of player's location is normalized

conditions.name: Is Wearing
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is wearing some armour.
conditions.examples:
player is wearing an iron chestplate and iron leggings
player is wearing all diamond armour

conditions.name: Is Whitelisted
conditions.description: Whether or not the server or a player is whitelisted.
conditions.examples:
if server is whitelisted:
if player is whitelisted

conditions.name: Is Within
conditions.description: Whether a location is within something else. The "something" can be a block, an entity, a chunk, a world, or a cuboid formed by two other locations. Note that using the is between condition will refer to a straight line between locations, while this condition will refer to the cuboid between locations.

conditions.name: Is Within Location
conditions.description: Whether a location is within two other locations forming a cuboid. Using the is between condition will refer to a straight line between locations.
conditions.examples:
if player's location is within {_loc1} and {_loc2}:
	send "You are in a PvP zone!" to player

conditions.name: Is Holding
conditions.description: Checks whether a player is holding a specific item. Cannot be used with endermen, use 'entity is [not] an enderman holding <item type>' instead.
conditions.examples:
player is holding a stick
victim isn't holding a sword of sharpness

conditions.name: Is Leashed
conditions.description: Checks to see if an entity is currently leashed.
conditions.examples: target entity is leashed

conditions.name: Matches
conditions.description: Checks whether the defined strings match the input regexes (Regular expressions).

conditions.name: Has Permission
conditions.description: Test whether a player has a certain permission.
conditions.examples:
player has permission "skript.tree"
victim has the permission "admin":
	send "You're attacking an admin!" to attacker

conditions.name: Has Played Before
conditions.description: Checks whether a player has played on this server before. You can also use on first join if you want to make triggers for new players.
conditions.examples:
player has played on this server before
player hasn't played before

conditions.name: Projectile Can Bounce
conditions.description: Whether or not a projectile can bounce.
conditions.examples:
on shoot:
	send "Boing!" to all players if projectile can bounce

conditions.name: PvP
conditions.description: Checks the PvP state of a world.
conditions.examples:
PvP is enabled
PvP is disabled in "world"

conditions.name: Resource Pack
conditions.description: Checks state of the resource pack in a resource pack request response event.

conditions.name: Is Bed/Anchor Spawn
conditions.description: Checks what the respawn location of a player in the respawn event is.
conditions.examples:
on respawn:
	the respawn location is a bed
	broadcast "%player% is respawning in their bed! So cozy!"

conditions.name: Is Script Loaded
conditions.description: Check if the current script, or another script, is currently loaded.
conditions.examples:
script is loaded
script "example.sk" is loaded

conditions.name: Starts/Ends With
conditions.description: Checks if a text starts or ends with another.
conditions.examples:
if the argument starts with "test" or "debug":
	send "Stop!"

conditions.name: Egg Will Hatch
conditions.description: Whether the egg will hatch in a Player Egg Throw event.

conditions.name: Is Within Radius
conditions.description: Checks whether a location is within a certain radius of another location.
conditions.examples:
on damage:
	if attacker's location is within 10 blocks around {_spawn}:
		cancel event
		send "You can't PVP in spawn."

conditions.name: Can Build
conditions.description: Tests whether a player is allowed to build at a certain location. This condition requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
conditions.examples:
command /setblock <material>:
	description: set the block at your crosshair to a different type
	trigger:
		player cannot build at the targeted block:
			message "You do not have permission to change blocks there!"
			stop
		set the targeted block to argument

conditions.name: Is Member/Owner of Region
conditions.description:
Checks whether a player is a member or owner of a particular region.
This condition requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
conditions.examples:
on region enter:
	player is the owner of the region
	message "Welcome back to %region%!"
	send "%player% just entered %region%!" to all members of the region

conditions.name: Region Contains
conditions.description: Checks whether a location is contained in a particular region. This condition requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.

conditions.name: Method Exists
conditions.description: Checks if a method exists
conditions.examples: if method "org.bukkit.Bukkit#getPluginCommand(java.lang.String)

conditions.name: Running Minecraft
conditions.description: Checks if current Minecraft version is given version or newer.
conditions.examples: running minecraft "1.14"

effects.name: Delay
effects.description: Delays the script's execution by a given timespan. Please note that delays are not persistent, e.g. trying to create a tempban script with ban player → wait 7 days → unban player will not work if you restart your server anytime within these 7 days. You also have to be careful even when using small delays!
effects.examples:
wait 2 minutes
halt for 5 minecraft hours
wait a tick

effects.name: Action Bar
effects.description: Sends an action bar message to the given player(s).
effects.examples: send action bar "Hello player!" to player

effects.name: Ban
effects.description: Bans or unbans a player or an IP address. If a reason is given, it will be shown to the player when they try to join the server while banned. A length of ban may also be given to apply a temporary ban. If it is absent for any reason, a permanent ban will be used instead. We recommend that you test your scripts so that no accidental permanent bans are applied. Note that banning people does not kick them from the server. Consider using the kick effect after applying a ban.
effects.examples:
unban player
ban "127.0.0.1"
IP-ban the player because "he is an idiot"
ban player due to "inappropriate language" for 2 days
patterns: ban %strings/offlineplayers% [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %-string%] [for %-timespan%]
ban %players% by IP [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %-string%] [for %-timespan%]
IP(-| )ban %players% [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %-string%] [for %-timespan%]

effects.name: Break Block
effects.description:
Breaks the block and spawns items as if a player had mined it

You can add a tool, which will spawn items based on how that tool would break the block 
(ie: When using a hand to break stone, it drops nothing, whereas with a pickaxe it drops cobblestone)
effects.examples:
on right click:
	break clicked block naturally
loop blocks in radius 10 around player:
	break loop-block using player's tool
loop blocks in radius 10 around player:
	break loop-block naturally using diamond pickaxe

effects.name: Broadcast
effects.description: Broadcasts a message to the server.
effects.examples:
broadcast "Welcome %player% to the server!"
broadcast "Woah! It's a message!"

effects.name: Cancel Command Cooldown
effects.description: Only usable in commands. Makes it so the current command usage isn't counted towards the cooldown.
effects.examples:
command /nick <text>:
	executable by: players
	cooldown: 10 seconds
	trigger:
		if length of arg-1 is more than 16:
			# Makes it so that invalid arguments don't make you wait for the cooldown again
			cancel the cooldown
			send "Your nickname may be at most 16 characters."
			stop
		set the player's display name to arg-1

effects.name: Cancel Drops
effects.description: Cancels drops of items or experiences in a death or block break event. Please note that this doesn't keep items or experiences of a dead player. If you want to do that, use the Keep Inventory / Experience effect.
effects.examples:
on death of a zombie:
	if name of the entity is "&cSpecial":
		cancel drops of items

on break of a coal ore:
	cancel the experience drops

effects.name: Cancel Event
effects.description: Cancels the event (e.g. prevent blocks from being placed, or damage being taken).
effects.examples:
on damage:
	victim is a player
	victim has the permission "skript.god"
	cancel the event

effects.name: Change: Set/Add/Remove/Delete/Reset
effects.description: A very general effect that can change many expressions. Many expressions can only be set and/or deleted, while some can have things added to or removed from them.
effects.examples: # set: Set the player's display name to "<red>%name of player%" set the block above the victim to lava # add: add 2 to the player's health # preferably use 'heal' for this add argument to {blacklist::*} give a diamond pickaxe of efficiency 5 to the player increase the data value of the clicked block by 1 # remove: remove 2 pickaxes from the victim subtract 2.5 from {points::%uuid of player%} # remove all: remove every iron tool from the player remove all minecarts from {entitylist::*} # delete: delete the block below the player clear drops delete {variable} # reset: reset walk speed of player reset chunk at the targeted block

effects.name: Charge Creeper
effects.description: Charges or uncharges a creeper. A creeper is charged when it has been struck by lightning.
effects.examples:
on spawn of creeper:
	charge the event-entity

effects.name: Color Items
effects.description: Colors items in a given color. You can also use RGB codes if you feel limited with the 16 default colors. RGB codes are three numbers from 0 to 255 in the order (red, green, blue), where (0,0,0) is black and (255,255,255) is white. Armor is colorable for all Minecraft versions. With Minecraft 1.11 or newer you can also color potions and maps. Note that the colors might not look exactly how you'd expect.
effects.examples:
dye player's helmet blue
color the player's tool red

effects.name: Command
effects.description: Executes a command. This can be useful to use other plugins in triggers.
effects.examples:
make player execute command "/suicide"
execute console command "/say Hello everyone!"

effects.name: Connect
effects.description: Connects a player to another bungeecord server
effects.examples: connect all players to "hub"

effects.name: Continue
effects.description: Skips the value currently being looped, moving on to the next value if it exists.
effects.examples:
loop all players:
	if loop-value does not have permission "moderator":
		continue # filter out non moderators
	broadcast "%loop-player% is a moderator!" # Only moderators get broadcast

effects.name: Do If
effects.description: Execute an effect if a condition is true.
effects.examples:
on join:
	give a diamond to the player if the player has permission "rank.vip"

effects.name: Drop
effects.description: Drops one or more items.
effects.examples:
on death of creeper:
	drop 1 TNT

effects.name: Enchant/Disenchant
effects.description: Enchant or disenchant an existing item.
effects.examples:
enchant the player's tool with sharpness 5
disenchant the player's tool

effects.name: Equip
effects.description: Equips or unequips an entity with some given armor. This will replace any armor that the entity is wearing.
effects.examples:
equip player with diamond helmet
equip player with all diamond armor
unequip diamond chestplate from player
unequip all armor from player
unequip player's armor

effects.name: Exit
effects.description: Exits a given amount of loops and conditionals, or the entire trigger.
effects.examples:
if player has any ore:
	stop
message "%player% has no ores!"
loop blocks above the player:
	loop-block is not air:
		exit 2 sections
	set loop-block to water

effects.name: Explode Creeper
effects.description: Starts the explosion process of a creeper or instantly explodes it.
effects.examples:
start explosion of the last spawned creeper
stop ignition of the last spawned creeper

effects.name: Explosion
effects.description: Creates an explosion of a given force. The Minecraft Wiki has an article on explosions which lists the explosion forces of TNT, creepers, etc. Hint: use a force of 0 to create a fake explosion that does no damage whatsoever, or use the explosion effect introduced in Skript 2.0. Starting with Bukkit 1.4.5 and Skript 2.0 you can use safe explosions which will damage entities but won't destroy any blocks.
effects.examples:
create an explosion of force 10 at the player
create an explosion of force 0 at the victim

effects.name: Feed
effects.description: Feeds the specified players.
effects.examples:
feed all players
feed the player by 5 beefs

effects.name: Launch firework
effects.description: Launch firework effects at the given location(s).
effects.examples: launch ball large colored red, purple and white fading to light green and black at player's location with duration 1

effects.name: Force Attack
effects.description: Makes a living entity attack an entity with a melee attack.
effects.examples:
spawn a wolf at player's location
make last spawned wolf attack player

effects.name: Damage/Heal/Repair
effects.description: Damage/Heal/Repair an entity, or item.
effects.examples:
damage player by 5 hearts
heal the player
repair tool of player

effects.name: Hide Player from Server List
effects.description: Hides a player from the hover list and decreases the online players count (only if the player count wasn't changed before).
effects.examples:
on server list ping:
	hide {vanished::*} from the server list

effects.name: Ignite/Extinguish
effects.description: Lights entities on fire or extinguishes them.
effects.examples:
ignite the player
extinguish the player

effects.name: Make Incendiary
effects.description: Sets if an entity's explosion will leave behind fire. This effect is also usable in an explosion prime event.
effects.examples:
on explosion prime:
	make the explosion fiery

effects.name: Make Invisible
effects.description:
Makes a living entity visible/invisible. This is not a potion and therefore does not have features such as a time limit or particles.
When setting an entity to invisible while using an invisibility potion on it, the potion will be overridden and when it runs out the entity keeps its invisibility.
effects.examples: make target entity invisible

effects.name: Make Invulnerable
effects.description: Makes an entity invulnerable/not invulnerable.
effects.examples: make target entity invulnerable

effects.name: Keep Inventory / Experience
effects.description: Keeps the inventory or/and experiences of the dead player in a death event.

effects.name: Kick
effects.description: Kicks a player from the server.
effects.examples:
on place of TNT, lava, or obsidian:
	kick the player due to "You may not place %block%!"
	cancel the event
patterns: kick %players% [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %-string%]

effects.name: Kill
effects.description:
Kills an entity.
Note: This effect does not set the entity's health to 0 (which causes issues), but damages the entity by 100 times its maximum health.
effects.examples:
kill the player
kill all creepers in the player's world
kill all endermen, witches and bats

effects.name: Knockback
effects.description: Apply the same velocity as a knockback to living entities in a direction. Mechanics such as knockback resistance will be factored in.
effects.examples:
knockback player north
knock victim (vector from attacker to victim) with strength 10

effects.name: Leash entities
effects.description: Leash living entities to other entities.
effects.examples: leash the player to the target entity

effects.name: Lightning
effects.description: Strike lightning at a given location. Can use 'lightning effect' to create a lightning that does not harm entities or start fires.
effects.examples:
strike lightning at the player
strike lightning effect at the victim

effects.name: Load Server Icon
effects.description: Loads server icons from the given files. You can get the loaded icon using the last loaded server icon expression. Please note that the image must be 64x64 and the file path starts from the server folder.

effects.name: Log
effects.description:
Writes text into a .log file. Skript will write these files to /plugins/Skript/logs.
NB: Using 'server.log' as the log file will write to the default server log. Omitting the log file altogether will log the message as '[Skript] [<script>.sk] <message>' in the server log.
effects.examples:
on place of TNT:
	log "%player% placed TNT in %world% at %location of block%" to "tnt/placement.log"

effects.name: Look At
effects.description: Forces the mob(s) or player(s) to look at an entity, vector or location. Vanilla max head pitches range from 10 to 50.
effects.examples:
force the head of the player to look towards event-entity's feet

on entity explosion:
	set {_player} to the nearest player
	{_player} is set
	distance between {_player} and the event-location is less than 15
	make {_player} look towards vector from the {_player} to location of the event-entity

force {_enderman} to face the block 3 meters above {_location} at head rotation speed 100.5 and max head pitch -40

effects.name: Make Egg Hatch
effects.description: Makes the egg hatch in a Player Egg Throw event.
effects.examples:
on player egg throw:
	# EGGS FOR DAYZ!
	make the egg hatch

effects.name: Make Fly
effects.description: Forces a player to start/stop flying.
effects.examples:
make player fly
force all players to stop flying

effects.name: Make Say
effects.description: Forces a player to send a message to the chat. If the message starts with a slash it will force the player to use command.
effects.examples:
make the player say "Hello."
force all players to send the message "I love this server"

effects.name: Message
effects.description: Sends a message to the given player. Only styles written in given string or in formatted expressions will be parsed. Adding an optional sender allows the messages to be sent as if a specific player sent them. This is useful with Minecraft 1.16.4's new chat ignore system, in which players can choose to ignore other players, but for this to work, the message needs to be sent from a player.
effects.examples:
message "A wild %player% appeared!"
message "This message is a distraction. Mwahaha!"
send "Your kill streak is %{kill streak::%uuid of player%}%." to player
if the targeted entity exists:
	message "You're currently looking at a %type of the targeted entity%!"
on chat:
	cancel event
	send "[%player%] >> %message%" to all players from player

effects.name: op/deop
effects.description: Grant/revoke a user operator state.
effects.examples:
op the player
deop all players

effects.name: Open Book
effects.description: Opens a written book to a player.
effects.examples: open book player's tool to player

effects.name: Open/Close Inventory
effects.description:
Opens an inventory to a player. The player can then access and modify the inventory as if it was a chest that he just opened.
Please note that currently 'show' and 'open' have the same effect, but 'show' will eventually show an unmodifiable view of the inventory in the future.
effects.examples:
show the victim's inventory to the player
open the player's inventory for the player

effects.name: Pathfind
effects.description: Make an entity pathfind towards a location or another entity. Not all entities can pathfind. If the pathfinding target is another entity, the entities may or may not continuously follow the target.
effects.examples:
make all creepers pathfind towards player
make all cows stop pathfinding
make event-entity pathfind towards player at speed 1

effects.name: Player Info Visibility
effects.description: Sets whether all player related information is hidden in the server list. The Vanilla Minecraft client will display ??? (dark gray) instead of player counts and will not show the hover hist when hiding player info. The version string can override the ???. Also the Online Players Count and Max Players expressions will return -1 when hiding player info.
effects.examples:
hide player info
hide player related information in the server list
reveal all player related info

effects.name: Player Visibility
effects.description: Change visibility of a player for the given players. When reveal is used in combination of the hidden players expression and the viewers are not specified, this will default it to the given player in the hidden players expression. Note: if a player was hidden and relogs, this player will be visible again.

effects.name: Play Sound
effects.description: Plays a sound at given location for everyone or just for given players, or plays a sound to specified players. Both Minecraft sound names and Spigot sound names are supported. Playing resource pack sounds are supported too. The sound category is 'master' by default. Please note that sound names can get changed in any Minecraft or Spigot version, or even removed from Minecraft itself.

effects.name: Poison/Cure
effects.description: Poison or cure a creature.
effects.examples:
poison the player
poison the victim for 20 seconds
cure the player from poison

effects.name: Potion Effects
effects.since: 2.0, 2.2-dev27 (ambient and particle-less potion effects), 2.5 (replacing existing effect), 2.5.2 (potion effects)
effects.description: Apply or remove potion effects to/from entities.
effects.examples:
apply swiftness 2 to the player
remove haste from the victim
on join:
	apply potion of strength of tier {strength.%player%} to the player for 999 days
apply potion effects of player's tool to player
patterns: apply [potion of] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] [[[of] tier] %-number%] to %livingentities% [for %-timespan%] [(1¦replacing [the] existing effect)]
apply ambient [potion of] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] [[[of] tier] %-number%] to %livingentities% [for %-timespan%] [(1¦replacing [the] existing effect)]
apply [potion of] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] [[[of] tier] %-number%] without [any] particles to %livingentities% [for %-timespan%] [(1¦replacing [the] existing effect)]

effects.name: Push
effects.description: Push entities around.
effects.examples:
push the player upwards
push the victim downwards at speed 0.5

effects.name: PvP
effects.description: Set the PvP state for a given world.
effects.examples:
enable PvP #(current world only)
disable PvP in all worlds

effects.name: Replace
effects.since: 2.0, 2.2-dev24 (replace in multiple strings and replace items in inventory), 2.5 (replace first, case sensitivity)
effects.description: Replaces all occurrences of a given text with another text. Please note that you can only change variables and a few expressions, e.g. a message or a line of a sign.
effects.examples:
replace "<item>" in {textvar} with "%item%"
replace every "&" with "§" in line 1
# The following acts as a simple chat censor, but it will e.g. censor mass, hassle, assassin, etc. as well:
on chat:
	replace all "kys", "idiot" and "noob" with "****" in the message
 
replace all stone and dirt in player's inventory and player's top inventory with diamond
patterns: replace first %strings% in %strings% with %string% [(1¦with case sensitivity)]
replace first %strings% with %string% in %string% [(1¦with case sensitivity)]

effects.name: Title - Reset
effects.description: Resets the title of the player to the default values.
effects.examples:
reset the titles of all players
reset the title

effects.name: Force Respawn
effects.description: Forces player(s) to respawn if they are dead. If this is called without delay from death event, one tick is waited before respawn attempt.
effects.examples:
on death of player:
	force event-player to respawn

effects.name: Return
effects.description: Makes a function return a value
effects.examples:
function double(i: number) :: number:
	return 2 * {_i}

effects.name: Enable/Disable/Reload Script File
effects.description: Enables, disables, or reloads a script file.
effects.examples:
reload script "test"
enable script file "testing"
unload script file "script.sk"

effects.name: Send Block Change
effects.description: Makes a player see a block as something it really isn't. BlockData support is only for MC 1.13+
effects.examples:
make player see block at player as dirt
make player see target block as campfire[facing=south]

effects.name: Send Resource Pack
effects.description: Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs. The client will download the resource pack in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. The URL must be a direct download link. The hash is used for caching, the player won't have to re-download the resource pack that way. The hash must be SHA-1, you can get SHA-1 hash of your resource pack using this online tool. The resource pack request action can be used to check status of the sent resource pack request.
effects.examples:
on join:
	send the resource pack from "URL" with hash "hash" to the player
patterns: send [the] resource pack [from [[the] URL]] %string% with hash %string% to %players%

effects.name: Title - Send
effects.description: Sends a title/subtitle to the given player(s) with optional fadein/stay/fadeout times for Minecraft versions 1.11 and above. If you're sending only the subtitle, it will be shown only if there's a title displayed at the moment, otherwise it will be sent with the next title. To show only the subtitle, use: send title " " with subtitle "yourtexthere" to player. Note: if no input is given for the times, it will keep the ones from the last title sent, use the reset title effect to restore the default values.
effects.examples:
send title "Competition Started" with subtitle "Have fun, Stay safe!" to player for 5 seconds
send title "Hi %player%" to player
send title "Loot Drop" with subtitle "starts in 3 minutes" to all players
send title "Hello %player%!" with subtitle "Welcome to our server" to player for 5 seconds with fadein 1 second and fade out 1 second
send subtitle "Party!" to all players

effects.name: Shear
effects.description: Shears or 'un-shears' a sheep. Please note that no wool is dropped, this only sets the 'sheared' state of the sheep.
effects.examples:
on rightclick on a sheep holding a sword:
	shear the clicked sheep

effects.name: Shoot
effects.description: Shoots a projectile (or any other entity) from a given entity.
effects.examples:
shoot an arrow
make the player shoot a creeper at speed 10
shoot a pig from the creeper

effects.name: Silence Entity
effects.description: Controls whether or not an entity is silent.
effects.examples: make target entity silent

effects.name: Stop Server
effects.description: Stops or restarts the server. If restart is used when the restart-script spigot.yml option isn't defined, the server will stop instead.
effects.examples:
stop the server
restart server

effects.name: Stop Sound
effects.description: Stops specific or all sounds from playing to a group of players. Both Minecraft sound names and Spigot sound names are supported. Resource pack sounds are supported too. The sound category is 'master' by default. A sound can't be stopped from a different category. Please note that sound names can get changed in any Minecraft or Spigot version, or even removed from Minecraft itself.
effects.examples:
stop sound "block.chest.open" for the player
stop playing sounds "ambient.underwater.loop" and "ambient.underwater.loop.additions" to the player
stop all sound for all players
stop sound in record category

effects.name: Locally Suppress Warning
effects.description: Suppresses target warnings from the current script.
effects.examples:
locally suppress missing conjunction warnings
suppress the variable save warnings

effects.name: Swing Hand
effects.description: Makes an entity swing their hand. This does nothing if the entity does not have an animation for swinging their hand.
effects.examples: make player swing their main hand

effects.name: Teleport
effects.description:
Teleport an entity to a specific location. 
This effect is delayed by default on Paper, meaning certain syntax such as the return effect for functions cannot be used after this effect.
The keyword 'force' indicates this effect will not be delayed, 
which may cause lag spikes or server crashes when using this effect to teleport entities to unloaded chunks.
effects.examples:
teleport the player to {homes.%player%}
teleport the attacker to the victim

effects.name: Toggle
effects.description: Toggle the state of a block.
effects.examples:
# use arrows to toggle switches, doors, etc.
on projectile hit:
	projectile is arrow
	toggle the block at the arrow

effects.name: Toggle Flight
effects.description: Toggle the flight mode of a player.
effects.examples: allow flight to event-player

effects.name: Tree
effects.description:
Creates a tree.
This may require that there is enough space above the given location and that the block below is dirt/grass, but it is possible that the tree will just grow anyways, possibly replacing every block in its path.
effects.examples: grow a tall redwood tree above the clicked block

effects.name: Vectors - Rotate Around Vector
effects.description: Rotates a vector around another vector
effects.examples: rotate {_v} around vector 1, 0, 0 by 90

effects.name: Vectors - Rotate around XYZ
effects.description: Rotates a vector around x, y, or z axis by some degrees
effects.examples:
rotate {_v} around x-axis by 90
rotate {_v} around y-axis by 90
rotate {_v} around z-axis by 90 degrees

effects.name: Vehicle
effects.description: Makes an entity ride another entity, e.g. a minecart, a saddled pig, an arrow, etc.
effects.examples:
make the player ride a saddled pig
make the attacker ride the victim

effects.name: Play Effect
effects.description: Plays a visual effect at a given location or on a given entity. Please note that some effects can only be played on entities, e.g. wolf hearts or the hurt effect, and that these are always visible to all players.
effects.examples:
play wolf hearts on the clicked wolf
show mob spawner flames at the targeted block to the player

expressions.name: Damage Cause
expressions.description: The damage cause of a damage event. Please click on the link for more information.
expressions.examples: damage cause is lava, fire or burning

expressions.name: Absorbed blocks
expressions.description: The blocks absorbed by a sponge block.
expressions.examples: the absorbed blocks

expressions.name: Affected Entities
expressions.description: The affected entities in the area cloud effect event.
expressions.examples:
on area cloud effect:
	loop affected entities:
		if loop-value is a player:
			send "WARNING: you've step on an area effect cloud!" to loop-value

expressions.name: All Banned Players/IPs
expressions.description: Obtains the list of all banned players or IP addresses.
expressions.examples:
command /banlist:
	trigger:
		send all the banned players

expressions.name: All commands
expressions.description: Returns all registered commands or all script commands.
expressions.examples:
send "Number of all commands: %size of all commands%"
send "Number of all script commands: %size of all script commands%"

expressions.name: Applied Enchantments
expressions.description:
The applied enchantments in an enchant event.
 Deleting or removing the applied enchantments will prevent the item's enchantment.
expressions.examples:
on enchant:
	set the applied enchantments to sharpness 10 and fire aspect 5

expressions.name: Argument
expressions.description:
Usable in script commands and command events. Holds the value of an argument given to the command, e.g. if the command "/tell <player> <text>" is used like "/tell Njol Hello Njol!" argument 1 is the player named "Njol" and argument 2 is "Hello Njol!".
One can also use the type of the argument instead of its index to address the argument, e.g. in the above example 'player-argument' is the same as 'argument 1'.
Please note that specifying the argument type is only supported in script commands.
expressions.examples:
give the item-argument to the player-argument
damage the player-argument by the number-argument
give a diamond pickaxe to the argument
add argument 1 to argument 2
heal the last argument

expressions.name: Attacked
expressions.description: The victim of a damage event, e.g. when a player attacks a zombie this expression represents the zombie. When using Minecraft 1.11+, this also covers the hit entity in a projectile hit event.
expressions.examples:
on damage:
	victim is a creeper
	damage the attacked by 1 heart

expressions.name: Attacker
expressions.description:
The attacker of a damage event, e.g. when a player attacks a zombie this expression represents the player.
Please note that the attacker can also be a block, e.g. a cactus or lava, but this expression will not be set in these cases.
expressions.examples:
on damage:
	attacker is a player
	health of attacker is less than or equal to 2
	damage victim by 1 heart

expressions.name: Block
expressions.description:
The block involved in the event, e.g. the clicked block or the placed block.
Can optionally include a direction as well, e.g. 'block above' or 'block in front of the player'.
expressions.examples:
block is ore
set block below to air
spawn a creeper above the block
loop blocks in radius 4:
	loop-block is obsidian
	set loop-block to water
block is a chest:
	clear the inventory of the block

expressions.name: Chat Format
expressions.description: Can be used to get/retrieve the chat format. The sender of a message is represented by [player] or [sender], and the message by [message] or [msg].
expressions.examples: set the chat format to "<yellow>[player]<light gray>: <green>[message]"

expressions.name: Chat Recipients
expressions.description: Recipients of chat events where this is called.
expressions.examples: chat recipients

expressions.name: Clicked Block/Entity/Inventory/Slot
expressions.description: The clicked block, entity, inventory, inventory slot, inventory click type or inventory action.

expressions.name: Cooldown Time/Remaining Time/Elapsed Time/Last Usage/Bypass Permission
expressions.description:
Only usable in command events. Represents the cooldown time, the remaining time, the elapsed time,
the last usage date, or the cooldown bypass permission.
expressions.examples:
command /home:
	cooldown: 10 seconds
	cooldown message: You last teleported home %elapsed time% ago, you may teleport home again in %remaining time%.
	trigger:
		teleport player to {home::%player%}

expressions.name: Command
expressions.description: The command that caused an 'on command' event (excluding the leading slash and all arguments)

expressions.name: Command Info
expressions.description: Get information about a command.
expressions.examples:
main name of command "skript"
description of command "help"
label of command "pl"
usage of command "help"
aliases of command "bukkit:help"
permission of command "/op"
command "op"'s permission message
command "sk"'s plugin owner

expressions.name: Command Sender
expressions.description: The player or the console who sent a command. Mostly useful in commands and command events. If the command sender is a command block, its location can be retrieved by using %block's location%
expressions.examples:
make the command sender execute "/say hi!"
on command:
	log "%executor% used command /%command% %arguments%" to "commands.log"

expressions.name: Damage
expressions.description: How much damage is done in a damage event, possibly ignoring armour, criticals and/or enchantments. Can be changed (remember that in Skript '1' is one full heart, not half a heart).
expressions.examples: increase the damage by 2

expressions.name: Drops
expressions.description: Only works in death events. Holds the drops of the dying creature. Drops can be prevented by removing them with "remove ... from drops", e.g. "remove all pickaxes from the drops", or "clear drops" if you don't want any drops at all.
expressions.examples:
clear drops
remove 4 planks from the drops

expressions.name: The Egg
expressions.description: The egg thrown in a Player Egg Throw event.
expressions.examples: spawn an egg at the egg

expressions.name: Enchanting Experience Cost
expressions.description:
The cost of enchanting in an enchant event.
This is number that was displayed in the enchantment table, not the actual number of levels removed.
expressions.examples:
on enchant:
	send "Cost: %the displayed enchanting cost%" to player

expressions.name: Enchant Item
expressions.description:
The enchant item in an enchant prepare event or enchant event.
It can be modified, but enchantments will still be applied in the enchant event.
expressions.examples:
on enchant:
	set the enchanted item to a diamond chestplate
on enchant prepare:
	set the enchant item to a wooden sword

expressions.name: Enchantment Bonus
expressions.description: The enchantment bonus in an enchant prepare event. This represents the number of bookshelves affecting/surrounding the enchantment table.
expressions.examples:
on enchant:
	send "There are %enchantment bonus% bookshelves surrounding this enchantment table!" to player

expressions.name: Enchantment Offer
expressions.description: The enchantment offer in enchant prepare events.
expressions.examples:
on enchant prepare:
	send "Your enchantment offers are: %the enchantment offers%" to player

expressions.name: Experience
expressions.description: How much experience was spawned in an experience spawn or block break event. Can be changed.
expressions.examples:
on experience spawn:
	add 5 to the spawned experience
on break of coal ore:
	clear dropped experience
on break of diamond ore:
	if tool of player = diamond pickaxe:
		add 100 to dropped experience

expressions.name: Explosion Yield
expressions.description: The yield of the explosion in an explosion prime event. This is how big the explosion is. When changing the yield, values less than 0 will be ignored. Read this wiki page for more information
expressions.examples:
on explosion prime:
	set the yield of the explosion to 10

expressions.name: Fertilized Blocks
expressions.description: The blocks fertilized in block fertilize events.
expressions.examples: the fertilized blocks

expressions.name: Final Damage
expressions.description: How much damage is done in a damage event, considering all types of damage reduction. Can NOT be changed.
expressions.examples: send "%final damage%" to victim

expressions.name: Hanging Entity/Remover
expressions.description: Returns the hanging entity or remover in hanging break and place events.

expressions.name: Hash
expressions.description:
Hashes the given text using the MD5 or SHA-256 algorithms. Each algorithm is suitable for different use cases.

MD5 is provided mostly for backwards compatibility, as it is outdated and not secure. SHA-256 is more secure, and can used to hash somewhat confidental data like IP addresses and even passwords. It is not that secure out of the box, so please consider using salt when dealing with passwords! When hashing data, you must specify algorithms that will be used for security reasons!

Please note that a hash cannot be reversed under normal circumstanses. You will not be able to get original value from a hash with Skript.
expressions.examples:
command /setpass <text>:
	trigger:
		set {password::%uuid of player%} to text-argument hashed with SHA-256
command /login <text>:
	trigger:
		if text-argument hashed with SHA-256 is {password::%uuid of player%}:
			message "Login successful."
		else:
			message "Wrong password!"

expressions.name: Hatching Number
expressions.description:
The number of entities that will be hatched in a Player Egg Throw event.
Please note that no more than 127 entities can be hatched at once.
expressions.examples:
on player egg throw:
	set the hatching number to 10

expressions.name: Hatching Entity Type
expressions.description: The type of the entity that will be hatched in a Player Egg Throw event.
expressions.examples:
on player egg throw:
	set the hatching entity type to a primed tnt

expressions.name: Heal Amount
expressions.description: The amount of health healed in a healing event.
expressions.examples:
increase heal amount by 2
remove 0.5 from heal amount

expressions.name: Heal Reason
expressions.description: The heal reason of a heal event. Please click on the link for more information.

expressions.name: Hostname
expressions.description: The hostname used by the connecting player to connect to the server in a connect event.
expressions.examples:
on connect:
	hostname is "testers.example.com"
	send "Welcome back tester!"

expressions.name: Hotbar Button
expressions.description: The hotbar button clicked in an inventory click event.
expressions.examples:
on inventory click:
	send "You clicked the hotbar button %hotbar button%!"

expressions.name: Hover List
expressions.description: The list when you hover on the player counts of the server in the server list. This can be changed using texts or players in a server list ping event only. Adding players to the list means adding the name of the players. And note that, for example if there are 5 online players (includes fake online count) in the server and the hover list is set to 3 values, Minecraft will show "... and 2 more ..." at end of the list.
expressions.examples:
on server list ping:
	clear the hover list
	add "&aWelcome to the &6Minecraft &aserver!" to the hover list
	add "" to the hover list # A blank line
	add "&cThere are &6%online players count% &conline players!" to the hover list

expressions.name: Inventory Action
expressions.description: The inventory action of an inventory event. Please click on the link for more information.
expressions.examples: inventory action is pickup all

expressions.name: Item
expressions.description: The item involved in an event, e.g. in a drop, dispense, pickup or craft event.
expressions.examples:
on dispense:
	item is a clock
	set the time to 6:00

expressions.name: Last Loaded Server Icon
expressions.description: Returns the last loaded server icon with the load server icon effect.
expressions.examples: set {server-icon} to the last loaded server icon

expressions.name: Last Spawned Entity
expressions.description: Holds the entity that was spawned most recently with the spawn effect (section), dropped with the drop effect, shot with the shoot effect or created with the lightning effect. Please note that even though you can spawn multiple mobs simultaneously (e.g. with 'spawn 5 creepers'), only the last spawned mob is saved and can be used. If you spawn an entity, shoot a projectile and drop an item you can however access all them together.
expressions.examples:
spawn a priest
set {healer::%spawned priest%} to true
shoot an arrow from the last spawned entity
ignite the shot projectile
drop a diamond sword
push last dropped item upwards
teleport player to last struck lightning
delete last launched firework

expressions.name: Location
expressions.description: The location where an event happened (e.g. at an entity or block), or a location relative to another (e.g. 1 meter above another location).
expressions.examples:
drop 5 apples at the event-location # exactly the same as writing 'drop 5 apples'
set {_loc} to the location 1 meter above the player

expressions.name: Vectors - Location Vector Offset
expressions.description: Returns the location offset by vectors.
expressions.examples: set {_loc} to {_loc} ~ {_v}

expressions.name: Loop value
expressions.description: The currently looped value.
expressions.examples:
# countdown:
loop 10 times:
	message "%11 - loop-number%"
	wait a second
# generate a 10x10 floor made of randomly colored wool below the player:
loop blocks from the block below the player to the block 10 east of the block below the player:
	loop blocks from the loop-block to the block 10 north of the loop-block:
		set loop-block-2 to any wool

expressions.name: Loot
expressions.description: The loot that will be generated in a 'loot generate' event.
expressions.examples:
on loot generate:
	chance of %10
	add 64 diamonds
	send "You hit the jackpot!!"

expressions.name: Me
expressions.description: A 'me' expression that can be used in players' effect commands only.
expressions.examples:
!heal me
!kick myself
!give a diamond axe to me

expressions.name: Mending Repair Amount
expressions.description:
The number of durability points an item is to be repaired in a mending event.
 Modifying the repair amount will affect how much experience is given to the player after mending.
expressions.examples:
on item mend:
	set the mending repair amount to 100

expressions.name: Message
expressions.description: The (chat) message of a chat event, the join message of a join event, the quit message of a quit event, or the death message on a death event. This expression is mostly useful for being changed.
expressions.examples:
on chat:
	player has permission "admin"
	set message to "&c%message%"

on first join:
	set join message to "Welcome %player% to our awesome server!"

on join:
	player has played before
	set join message to "Welcome back, %player%!"

on quit:
	set quit message to "%player% left this awesome server!"

on death:
	set the death message to "%player% died!"

expressions.name: MOTD
expressions.description: The message of the day in the server list. This can be changed in a server list ping event only. 'default MOTD' returns the default MOTD always and can't be changed.
expressions.examples:
on server list ping:
	set the motd to "Join now!"

expressions.name: Now
expressions.description: The current system time of the server. Use time to get the Minecraft time of a world.
expressions.examples: broadcast "Current server time: %now%"

expressions.name: Number of Characters
expressions.description: The number of uppercase, lowercase, or digit characters in a string.
expressions.examples:
#Simple Chat Filter
on chat:
	if number of uppercase chars in message / length of message > 0.5
		cancel event
		send "<red>Your message has to many caps!" to player

expressions.name: Offline players
expressions.description: All players that have ever joined the server. This includes the players currently online.
expressions.examples: send "Size of all players who have joined the server: %size of all offline players%"

expressions.name: All Operators
expressions.description: The list of operators on the server.
expressions.examples: set {_ops::*} to all operators

expressions.name: Parse Error
expressions.description: The error which caused the last parse operation to fail, which might not be set if a pattern was used and the pattern didn't match the provided text at all.

expressions.name: Loaded Plugins
expressions.description: An expression to obtain a list of the names of the server's loaded plugins.

expressions.name: Portal
expressions.description: The blocks associated with a portal in the portal creation event.
expressions.examples:
on portal creation:
	loop portal blocks:
		broadcast "%loop-block% is part of a portal!"

expressions.name: Protocol Version
expressions.description: The protocol version that will be sent as the protocol version of the server in a server list ping event. For more information and list of protocol versions visit wiki.vg. If this protocol version doesn't match with the protocol version of the client, the client will see the version string. But please note that, this expression has no visual effect over the version string. For example if the server uses PaperSpigot 1.12.2, and you make the protocol version 107 (1.9), the version string will not be "Paper 1.9", it will still be "Paper 1.12.2". But then you can customize the version string as you wish. Also if the protocol version of the player is higher than protocol version of the server, it will say "Server out of date!", and if vice-versa "Client out of date!" when you hover on the ping bars. This can be set in a server list ping event only (increase and decrease effects cannot be used because that wouldn't make sense).
expressions.examples:
on server list ping:
	set the version string to "<light green>Version: <orange>%minecraft version%"
	set the protocol version to 0 # 13w41a (1.7) - so the player will see the custom version string almost always

expressions.name: Moved blocks
expressions.description: Blocks which are moved in a piston event. Cannot be used outside of piston events.
expressions.examples: the moved blocks

expressions.name: Random UUID
expressions.description: Returns a random UUID.
expressions.examples: set {_uuid} to random uuid

expressions.name: Raw Name
expressions.description: The raw Minecraft material name of the given item. Note that this is not guaranteed to give same results on all servers.
expressions.examples: raw name of tool of player

expressions.name: Respawn location
expressions.description: The location that a player should respawn at. This is used within the respawn event.
expressions.examples:
on respawn:
	set respawn location to {example::spawn}

expressions.name: Script Name
expressions.description: Holds the current script's name (the file name without '.sk').
expressions.examples:
on script load:
	set {running::%script%} to true
on script unload:
	set {running::%script%} to false

expressions.name: All Scripts
expressions.description: Returns all of the scripts, or just the enabled or disabled ones.
expressions.examples:
command /scripts:
	trigger:
		send "All Scripts: %scripts%" to player
		send "Loaded Scripts: %enabled scripts%" to player
		send "Unloaded Scripts: %disabled scripts%" to player

expressions.name: Shooter
expressions.description: The shooter of a projectile.
expressions.examples: shooter is a skeleton

expressions.name: Source Block
expressions.description: The source block in a spread event.

expressions.name: Spawn Reason
expressions.description: The spawn reason in a spawn event.
expressions.examples:
on spawn:
	spawn reason is reinforcements or breeding

expressions.name: Special Number
expressions.description: Special number values, namely NaN, Infinity and -Infinity
expressions.examples: if {_number} is NaN value:

expressions.name: Case Text
expressions.description: Copy of given text in Lowercase, Uppercase, Proper Case, camelCase, PascalCase, Snake_Case, and Kebab-Case
expressions.examples:
"Oops!" in lowercase # oops!
"oops!" in uppercase # OOPS!
"hellO i'm steve!" in proper case # HellO I'm Steve!
"hellO i'm steve!" in strict proper case # Hello I'm Steve!
"spAwn neW boSs ()" in camel case # spAwnNeWBoSs()
"spAwn neW boSs ()" in strict camel case # spawnNewBoss()
"geneRate ranDom numBer ()" in pascal case # GeneRateRanDomNumBer()
"geneRate ranDom numBer ()" in strict pascal case # GenerateRandomNumber()
"Hello Player!" in snake case # Hello_Player!
"Hello Player!" in lower snake case # hello_player!
"Hello Player!" in upper snake case # HELLO_PLAYER!
"What is your name?" in kebab case # What-is-your-name?
"What is your name?" in lower kebab case # what-is-your-name?
"What is your name?" in upper kebab case # WHAT-IS-YOUR-NAME?

expressions.name: Tamer
expressions.description: The tamer of an entity. Can only be used in entity tame events. You can use 'event-entity' to refer tamed entity itself.

expressions.name: Teleport Cause
expressions.description: The teleport cause within a player teleport event.
expressions.examples:
on teleport
	teleport cause is nether portal, end portal or end gateway

expressions.name: X Times
expressions.description: Integers between 1 and X, used in loops to loop X times.
expressions.examples:
loop 20 times:
	broadcast "%21 - loop-number% seconds left.."
	wait 1 second

expressions.name: TPS (ticks per second)
expressions.description: Returns the 3 most recent TPS readings, like the /tps command. This expression is only supported on some server software (PaperSpigot).
expressions.examples: broadcast "%tps%"

expressions.name: Vectors - Angle Between
expressions.description: Gets the angle between two vectors.
expressions.examples: send "%the angle between vector 1, 0, 0 and vector 0, 1, 1%"

expressions.name: Vectors - Arithmetic
expressions.description: Arithmetic expressions for vectors.

expressions.name: Vectors - Vector Between Locations
expressions.description: Creates a vector between two locations.
expressions.examples: set {_v} to vector between {_loc1} and {_loc2}

expressions.name: Vectors - Cross Product
expressions.description: Gets the cross product between two vectors.
expressions.examples: send "%vector 1, 0, 0 cross vector 0, 1, 0%"

expressions.name: Vectors - Cylindrical Shape
expressions.description: Forms a 'cylindrical shaped' vector using yaw to manipulate the current point.
expressions.examples:
loop 360 times:
	set {_v} to cylindrical vector radius 1, yaw loop-value, height 2
set {_v} to cylindrical vector radius 1, yaw 90, height 2

expressions.name: Vectors - Dot Product
expressions.description: Gets the dot product between two vectors.
expressions.examples: set {_v} to {_v2} dot {_v3}

expressions.name: Vectors - Create from XYZ
expressions.description: Creates a vector from x, y and z values.
expressions.examples: set {_v} to vector 0, 1, 0

expressions.name: Vectors - Vector from Pitch and Yaw
expressions.description: Creates a vector from a yaw and pitch value.
expressions.examples: set {_v} to vector from yaw 45 and pitch 45

expressions.name: Vectors - Normalized
expressions.description: Returns the same vector but with length 1.
expressions.examples: set {_v} to normalized {_v}

expressions.name: Vectors - Vector from Location
expressions.description: Creates a vector from a location.
expressions.examples: set {_v} to vector of {_loc}

expressions.name: Vectors - Random Vector
expressions.description: Creates a random unit vector.
expressions.examples: set {_v} to a random vector

expressions.name: Vectors - Spherical Shape
expressions.description: Forms a 'spherical shaped' vector using yaw and pitch to manipulate the current point.
expressions.examples:
loop 360 times:
	set {_v} to spherical vector radius 1, yaw loop-value, pitch loop-value
set {_v} to spherical vector radius 1, yaw 45, pitch 90

expressions.name: Version
expressions.description: The version of Bukkit, Minecraft or Skript respectively.
expressions.examples:
message "This server is running Minecraft %minecraft version% on Bukkit %bukkit version%"
message "This server is powered by Skript %skript version%"

expressions.name: Version String
expressions.description: The text to show if the protocol version of the server doesn't match with protocol version of the client. You can check the protocol version expression for more information about this. This can only be set in a server list ping event.
expressions.examples:
on server list ping:
	set the protocol version to 0 # 13w41a (1.7), so it will show the version string always
	set the version string to "<light green>Version: <orange>%minecraft version%"

expressions.name: Whitelist
expressions.description: A server's whitelist.This expression can be used to add/remove players to/from the whitelist, to enable it and disable it (set whitelist to true / set whitelist to false), and to empty it (reset whitelist)
expressions.examples:
set whitelist to false
add all players to whitelist
reset the whitelist

expressions.name: World from Name
expressions.description: Returns the world from a string.
expressions.examples:
world named {game::world-name}
the world "world"

expressions.name: Worlds
expressions.description: All worlds of the server, useful for looping.
expressions.examples:
loop all worlds:
	broadcast "You're in %loop-world%" to loop-world

expressions.name: Console
expressions.description: Represents the server's console which can receive messages and execute commands
expressions.examples:
execute console command "/stop"
send "message to console" to the console

expressions.name: New Line
expressions.description: Returns a line break separator.
expressions.examples: send "Hello%nl%Goodbye!" to player

expressions.name: Pi
expressions.description: Returns the mathematical constant pi. (approx. 3.1415926535)
expressions.examples: set {_tau} to pi * 2

expressions.name: Region
expressions.description: The region involved in an event. This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.

expressions.name: All Groups
expressions.description: All the groups a player can have. This expression requires Vault and a compatible permissions plugin to be installed.
expressions.examples:
command /group <text>:
	trigger:
		if argument is "list":
			send "%all groups%"

expressions.name: Alphabetical Sort
expressions.description: Sorts given strings in alphabetical order.
expressions.examples: set {_list::*} to alphabetically sorted {_strings::*}

expressions.name: Block
expressions.description:
The block involved in the event, e.g. the clicked block or the placed block.
Can optionally include a direction as well, e.g. 'block above' or 'block in front of the player'.
expressions.examples:
block is ore
set block below to air
spawn a creeper above the block
loop blocks in radius 4:
	loop-block is obsidian
	set loop-block to water
block is a chest:
	clear the inventory of the block

expressions.name: Blocks
expressions.description:
Blocks relative to other blocks or between other blocks. Can be used to get blocks relative to other blocks or for looping.
Blocks from/to and between will return a straight line whereas blocks within will return a cuboid.
expressions.examples:
loop blocks above the player:
loop blocks between the block below the player and the targeted block:
set the blocks below the player, the victim and the targeted block to air
set all blocks within {loc1} and {loc2} to stone
set all blocks within chunk at player to air

expressions.name: Block Sphere
expressions.description: All blocks in a sphere around a center, mostly useful for looping.
expressions.examples:
loop blocks in radius 5 around the player:
	set loop-block to air

expressions.name: Block Break Speed
expressions.description: Gets the speed at which the given player would break this block, taking into account tools, potion effects, whether or not the player is in water, enchantments, etc. The returned value is the amount of progress made in breaking the block each tick. When the total breaking progress reaches 1.0, the block is broken. Note that the break speed can change in the course of breaking a block, e.g. if a potion effect is applied or expires, or the player jumps/enters water.
expressions.examples:
on left click using diamond pickaxe:
	event-block is set
	send "Break Speed: %break speed for player%" to player

expressions.name: Custom Chest Inventory
expressions.description: Returns a chest inventory with the given amount of rows and the name. Use the open inventory effect to open it.
expressions.examples:
open chest inventory with 1 row named "test" to player
set {_inventory} to chest inventory with 1 row

expressions.name: Colored / Uncolored
expressions.description: Parses <color>s and, optionally, chat styles in a message or removes any colors and chat styles from the message. Parsing all chat styles requires this expression to be used in same line with the send effect.
expressions.examples:
on chat:
	set message to colored message # Safe; only colors get parsed
command /fade <player>:
	trigger:
		set display name of the player-argument to uncolored display name of the player-argument
command /format <text>:
	trigger:
		message formatted text-argument # Safe, because we're sending to whoever used this command

expressions.name: Damaged Item
expressions.description: Directly damages an item. In MC versions 1.12.2 and lower, this can be used to apply data values to items/blocks
expressions.examples:
give player diamond sword with damage value 100
set player's tool to diamond hoe damaged by 250
give player diamond sword with damage 700 named "BROKEN SWORD"
set {_item} to diamond hoe with damage value 50 named "SAD HOE"
set target block of player to wool with data value 1
set target block of player to potato plant with data value 7

expressions.name: Date Ago/Later
expressions.description: A date the specified timespan before/after another date.

expressions.name: Default Value
expressions.description: A shorthand expression for giving things a default value. If the first thing isn't set, the second thing will be returned.
expressions.examples: broadcast {score::%player's uuid%} otherwise "%player% has no score!"

expressions.name: Difference
expressions.description: The difference between two values, e.g. numbers, dates or times.
expressions.examples:
if difference between {command::%player%::lastuse} and now is smaller than a minute:
	message "You have to wait a minute before using this command again!"

expressions.name: Direction
expressions.description: A helper expression for the direction type.
expressions.examples:
thrust the player upwards
set the block behind the player to water
loop blocks above the player:
	set {_rand} to a random integer between 1 and 10
	set the block {_rand} meters south east of the loop-block to stone
block in horizontal facing of the clicked entity from the player is air
spawn a creeper 1.5 meters horizontally behind the player
spawn a TNT 5 meters above and 2 meters horizontally behind the player
thrust the last spawned TNT in the horizontal direction of the player with speed 0.2
push the player upwards and horizontally forward at speed 0.5
push the clicked entity in in the direction of the player at speed -0.5
open the inventory of the block 2 blocks below the player to the player
teleport the clicked entity behind the player
grow a regular tree 2 meters horizontally behind the player

expressions.name: Distance
expressions.description: The distance between two points.
expressions.examples:
if the distance between the player and {home::%uuid of player%} is smaller than 20:
	message "You're very close to your home!"

expressions.name: Drops Of Block
expressions.description: A list of the items that will drop when a block is broken.
expressions.examples:
on break of block:
	give drops of block using player's tool to player

expressions.name: Entity Attribute
expressions.description:
The numerical value of an entity's particular attribute.
Note that the movement speed attribute cannot be reliably used for players. For that purpose, use the speed expression instead.
Resetting an entity's attribute is only available in Minecraft 1.11 and above.
expressions.examples:
on damage of player:
	send "You are wounded!"
	set victim's attack speed attribute to 2

expressions.name: Exploded Blocks
expressions.description: Get all the blocks that were destroyed in an explode event

expressions.name: Filter
expressions.description: Filters a list based on a condition. For example, if you ran 'broadcast "something" and "something else" where [string input is "something"]', only "something" would be broadcast as it is the only string that matched the condition.
expressions.examples: send "congrats on being staff!" to all players where [player input has permission "staff"]

expressions.name: Filter Input
expressions.description: Represents the input in a filter expression. For example, if you ran 'broadcast "something" and "something else" where [input is "something"]the condition would be checked twice, using "something" and "something else" as the inputs.
expressions.examples: send "congrats on being staff!" to all players where [input has permission "staff"]

expressions.name: Firework Effect
expressions.description: Represents a 'firework effect' which can be used in the launch firework effect.
expressions.examples:
launch flickering trailing burst firework colored blue and green at player
launch trailing flickering star colored purple, yellow, blue, green and red fading to pink at target entity
launch ball large colored red, purple and white fading to light green and black at player's location with duration 1

expressions.name: Gamerule Value
expressions.description: The gamerule value of a world.
