expressions.examples: set the gamerule commandBlockOutput of world "world" to false

expressions.name: Index Of
expressions.description: The first or last index of a character (or text) in a text, or -1 if it doesn't occur in the text. Indices range from 1 to the length of the text.

expressions.name: Indices of List
expressions.examples:
set {l::*} to "some", "cool" and "values"
broadcast "%indices of {l::*}%" # result is 1, 2 and 3

set {_leader-board::first} to 17
set {_leader-board::third} to 30
set {_leader-board::second} to 25
set {_leader-board::fourth} to 42
set {_ascending-indices::*} to sorted indices of {_leader-board::*} in ascending order
broadcast "%{_ascending-indices::*}%" #result is first, second, third, fourth
set {_descending-indices::*} to sorted indices of {_leader-board::*} in descending order
broadcast "%{_descending-indices::*}%" #result is fourth, third, second, first

expressions.name: Inventory Slot
expressions.description: Represents a slot in an inventory. It can be used to change the item in an inventory too.
expressions.examples:
if slot 0 of player is air:
	set slot 0 of player to 2 stones
	remove 1 stone from slot 0 of player
	add 2 stones to slot 0 of player
	clear slot 1 of player

expressions.name: Items
expressions.description: Items or blocks of a specific type, useful for looping.
expressions.examples:
loop items of type ore and log:
	block contains loop-item
	message "Theres at least one %loop-item% in this block"
drop all blocks at the player # drops one of every block at the player

expressions.name: Join & Split
expressions.description: Joins several texts with a common delimiter (e.g. ", "), or splits a text into multiple texts at a given delimiter.
expressions.examples:
message "Online players: %join all players with "" | ""%" # %all players% would use the default "x, y, and z"
set {_s::*} to the string argument split at ","

expressions.name: Location
expressions.description: The location where an event happened (e.g. at an entity or block), or a location relative to another (e.g. 1 meter above another location).
expressions.examples:
drop 5 apples at the event-location # exactly the same as writing 'drop 5 apples'
set {_loc} to the location 1 meter above the player

expressions.name: Location At
expressions.description: Allows to create a location from three coordinates and a world.
expressions.examples:
set {_loc} to the location at arg-1, arg-2, arg-3 of the world arg-4
distance between the player and the location (0, 0, 0) is less than 200

expressions.name: Nearest Entity
expressions.description: Gets the entity nearest to a location or another entity.
expressions.examples:
kill the nearest pig and cow relative to player
teleport player to the nearest cow relative to player
teleport player to the nearest entity relative to player

on click:
	kill nearest pig

expressions.name: Numbers
expressions.description:
All numbers between two given numbers, useful for looping.
Use 'numbers' if your start is not an integer and you want to keep the fractional part of the start number constant, or use 'integers' if you only want to loop integers.
You may also use 'decimals' if you want to use the decimal precision of the start number.
You may want to use the 'times' expression instead, for instance 'loop 5 times:'
expressions.examples:
loop numbers from 2.5 to 5.5: # loops 2.5, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5
loop integers from 2.9 to 5.1: # same as '3 to 5', i.e. loops 3, 4, 5
loop decimals from 3.94 to 4: # loops 3.94, 3.95, 3.96, 3.97, 3.98, 3.99, 4

expressions.name: Parse
expressions.description: Parses text as a given type, or as a given pattern. This expression can be used in two different ways: One which parses the entire text as a single instance of a type, e.g. as a number, and one that parses the text according to a pattern. If the given text could not be parsed, this expression will return nothing and the parse error will be set if some information is available. Some notes about parsing with a pattern: - The pattern must be a Skript pattern, e.g. percent signs are used to define where to parse which types, e.g. put a %number% or %items% in the pattern if you expect a number or some items there. - You have to save the expression's value in a list variable, e.g. set {parsed::*} to message parsed as "...". - The list variable will contain the parsed values from all %types% in the pattern in order. If a type was plural, e.g. %items%, the variable's value at the respective index will be a list variable, e.g. the values will be stored in {parsed::1::*}, not {parsed::1}.
expressions.examples:
set {var} to line 1 parsed as number
on chat:
	set {var::*} to message parsed as "buying %items% for %money%"
	if parse error is set:
		message "%parse error%"
	else if {var::*} is set:
		cancel event
		remove {var::2} from the player's balance
		give {var::1::*} to the player

expressions.name: Plain Item
expressions.description: A plain item is an item with no modifications. It can be used to convert items to their default state or to match with other default items.
expressions.examples:
if the player's tool is a plain diamond: # check if player's tool has no modifications
	send "You are holding a plain diamond!"

expressions.name: Potion Effect
expressions.description:
Create a new potion effect to apply to an entity or item type. Do note that when applying potion effects 
to tipped arrows/lingering potions, Minecraft reduces the timespan.
expressions.examples:
set {_p} to potion effect of speed of tier 1 without particles for 10 minutes
add {_p} to potion effects of player's tool
add {_p} to potion effects of target entity
add potion effect of speed 1 to potion effects of player
patterns: [new] ambient potion effect of %potioneffecttype% [potion] [[[of] tier] %-number%] [(1¦without particles)] [for %-timespan%]

expressions.name: Potion Effect Tier
expressions.description: An expression to obtain the amplifier of a potion effect applied to an entity.
expressions.examples: if the amplifier of haste of player >= 3:

expressions.name: Random
expressions.description: Gets a random item out of a set, e.g. a random player out of all players online.
expressions.examples:
give a diamond to a random player out of all players
give a random item out of all items to the player

expressions.name: Random Number
expressions.description: A random number or integer between two given numbers. Use 'number' if you want any number with decimal parts, or use use 'integer' if you only want whole numbers. Please note that the order of the numbers doesn't matter, i.e. random number between 2 and 1 will work as well as random number between 1 and 2.
expressions.examples:
set the player's health to a random number between 5 and 10
send "You rolled a %random integer from 1 to 6%!" to the player

expressions.name: Raw String
expressions.description: Returns the string without formatting (colors etc.) and without stripping them from it, e.g. raw "&aHello There!" would output &aHello There!
expressions.examples: send raw "&aThis text is unformatted!" to all players

expressions.name: Reversed List
expressions.description: Reverses given list.
expressions.examples: set {_list::*} to reversed {_list::*}

expressions.name: Sets
expressions.description: Returns a list of all the values of a type; useful for looping.
expressions.examples:
loop all attribute types:
	set loop-value attribute of player to 10
	message "Set attribute %loop-value% to 10!"

expressions.name: Shuffled List
expressions.description: Shuffles given list randomly. This is done by replacing indices by random numbers in resulting list.
expressions.examples: set {_list::*} to shuffled {_list::*}

expressions.name: Sorted List
expressions.description:
Sorts given list in natural order. All objects in list must be comparable;
if they're not, this expression will return nothing.
expressions.examples: set {_sorted::*} to sorted {_players::*}

expressions.name: Substring
expressions.description: Extracts part of a text. You can either get the first <x> characters, the last <x> characters, the character at index <x>, or the characters between indices <x> and <y>. The indices <x> and <y> should be between 1 and the length of the text (other values will be fit into this range).
expressions.examples:
set {_s} to the first 5 characters of the text argument
message "%subtext of {_s} from characters 2 to (the length of {_s} - 1)%" # removes the first and last character from {_s} and sends it to the player or console
set {_characters::*} to characters at 1, 2 and 7 in player's display name
send the last character of all players' names

expressions.name: Targeted Block
expressions.description: The block at the crosshair. This regards all blocks that are not air as fully solid, e.g. torches will be like a solid stone block for this expression.
expressions.examples:
# A command to set the block a player looks at to a specific type:
command /setblock <material>:
	trigger:
		set targeted block to argument

expressions.name: Ternary
expressions.description: A shorthand expression for returning something based on a condition.
expressions.examples: set {points} to 500 if {admin::%player's uuid%} is set else 100

expressions.name: Value Within
expressions.description: Gets the value within objects. Usually used with variables to get the value they store rather than the variable itself, or with lists to get the values of a type.
expressions.examples:
set {_entity} to a random entity out of all entities
delete entity within {_entity} # This deletes the entity itself and not the value stored in the variable

set {_list::*} to "something", 10, "test" and a zombie
broadcast the strings within {_list::*} # "something", "test"

expressions.name: Vectors - Vector Projection
expressions.description: An expression to get the vector projection of two vectors.
expressions.examples: set {_projection} to vector projection of vector(1, 2, 3) onto vector(4, 4, 4)

expressions.name: Blocks in Region
expressions.description: All blocks in a region. This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
expressions.examples:
loop all blocks in the region {arena.%{faction.%player%}%}:
	clear the loop-block

expressions.name: Age of Block/Entity
expressions.description:
Returns the age or maximum age of blocks and age for entities (there in no maximum age for entities).
For blocks, 'Age' represents the different growth stages that a crop-like block can go through. A value of 0 indicates that the crop was freshly planted, whilst a value equal to 'maximum age' indicates that the crop is ripe and ready to be harvested.
For entities, 'Age' represents the time left for them to become adults and it's in minus increasing to be 0 which means they're adults, e.g. A baby cow needs 20 minutes to become an adult which equals to 24,000 ticks so their age will be -24000 once spawned.
expressions.examples:
# Set targeted crop to fully grown crop
set age of targeted block to maximum age of targeted block
 
# Spawn a baby cow that will only need 1 minute to become an adult
spawn a baby cow at player
set age of last spawned entity to -1200 # in ticks = 60 seconds

expressions.name: Entity AI
expressions.description: Returns whether an entity has AI.
expressions.examples: set artificial intelligence of target entity to false

expressions.name: Altitude
expressions.description: Effectively an alias of 'y-coordinate of …', it represents the height of some object above bedrock.
expressions.examples:
on damage:
	altitude of the attacker is higher than the altitude of the victim
	set damage to damage * 1.2

expressions.name: Amount
expressions.description:
The amount of something. Please note that amount of %items% will not return the number of items, but the number of stacks, e.g. 1 for a stack of 64 torches. To get the amount of items in a stack, see the item amount expression. Also, you can get the recursive size of a list, which will return the recursive size of the list with sublists included, e.g. 
{list::*} Structure

  ├──── {list::1}: 1

  ├──── {list::2}: 2

  │     ├──── {list::2::1}: 3

  │     │    └──── {list::2::1::1}: 4

  │     └──── {list::2::2}: 5

  └──── {list::3}: 6
Where using %size of {list::*}% will only return 3 (the first layer of indices only), while %recursive size of {list::*}% will return 6 (the entire list) Please note that getting a list's recursive size can cause lag if the list is large, so only use this expression if you need to!
expressions.examples: message "There are %number of all players% players online!"

expressions.name: Amount of Items
expressions.description: Counts how many of a particular item type are in a given inventory.
expressions.examples: message "You have %number of ores in the player's inventory% ores in your inventory."

expressions.name: Anvil Text Input
expressions.description: An expression to get the name to be applied to an item in an anvil inventory.
expressions.examples:
on inventory click:
	type of event-inventory is anvil inventory
	if the anvil input text of the event-inventory is "FREE OP":
		ban player

expressions.name: Armour Slot
expressions.description: A part of a player's armour, i.e. the boots, leggings, chestplate or helmet.
expressions.examples:
set chestplate of the player to a diamond chestplate
helmet of player is neither a helmet nor air # player is wearing a block, e.g. from another plugin

expressions.name: Arrow Knockback Strength
expressions.description: An arrow's knockback strength.
expressions.examples:
on shoot:
	event-projectile is an arrow
	set arrow knockback strength of event-projectile to 10

expressions.name: Arrows Stuck
expressions.description: The number of arrows stuck in a living entity.
expressions.examples: set arrows stuck in player to 5

expressions.name: Attack Cooldown
expressions.description:
Returns the current cooldown for a player's attack. This is used to calculate damage, with 1.0 representing a fully charged attack and 0.0 representing a non-charged attack.
NOTE: Currently this can not be set to anything.
expressions.examples:
on damage:
	if attack cooldown of attacker < 1:
		set damage to 0
		send "Your hit was too weak! wait until your weapon is fully charged next time." to attacker

expressions.name: Bed
expressions.description: Returns the bed location of a player, i.e. the spawn point of a player if they ever slept in a bed and the bed still exists and is unobstructed however, you can set the unsafe bed location of players and they will respawn there even if it has been obstructed or doesn't exist anymore and that's the default behavior of this expression otherwise you will need to be specific i.e. safe bed location. NOTE: Offline players can not have their bed location changed, only online players.

expressions.name: Biome
expressions.description: The biome at a certain location. Please note that biomes are only defined for x/z-columns (i.e. the altitude (y-coordinate) doesn't matter), up until Minecraft 1.15.x. As of Minecraft 1.16, biomes are now 3D (per block vs column).
expressions.examples:
# damage player in deserts constantly
every real minute:
	loop all players:
		biome at loop-player is desert
		damage the loop-player by 1

expressions.name: Block Data
expressions.description: Get the block data associated with a block. This data can also be used to set blocks.

expressions.name: Block Hardness
expressions.description: Obtains the block's hardness level (also known as "strength"). This number is used to calculate the time required to break each block.
expressions.examples:
set {_hard} to block hardness of target block
if block hardness of target block > 5:

expressions.name: Book Author
expressions.description: The author of a book.
expressions.examples:
on book sign:
	message "Book Title: %author of event-item%"

expressions.name: Book Pages
expressions.description: The pages of a book.
expressions.examples:
on book sign:
	message "Book Pages: %pages of event-item%"
	message "Book Page 1: %page 1 of event-item%"
set page 1 of player's held item to "Book writing"

expressions.name: Book Title
expressions.description: The title of a book.
expressions.examples:
on book sign:
	message "Book Title: %title of event-item%"

expressions.name: Burn/Cook Time
expressions.description: The time a furnace takes to burn an item in a fuel burn event. Can also be used to change the burn/cook time of a placed furnace.

expressions.name: Respawn Anchor Charges
expressions.description: The charges of a respawn anchor.
expressions.examples: set the charges of event-block to 3

expressions.name: Chunk
expressions.description: The chunk a block, location or entity is in.
expressions.examples: add the chunk at the player to {protected chunks::*}

expressions.name: View Distance of Client
expressions.description: The view distance of the client. Can not be changed. This differs from the server side view distance of player as this will retrieve the view distance the player has set on their client.
expressions.examples:
set {_clientView} to the client view distance of player
set view distance of player to client view distance of player

expressions.name: Color of
expressions.description: The color of an item, can also be used to color chat messages with "<%color of ...%>this text is colored!".
expressions.examples:
on click on wool:
	message "This wool block is <%color of block%>%color of block%<reset>!"
	set the color of the block to black

expressions.name: Compass Target
expressions.description: The location a player's compass is pointing at.

expressions.name: Coordinate
expressions.description: Represents a given coordinate of a location.
expressions.examples:
player's y-coordinate is smaller than 40:
	message "Watch out for lava!"

expressions.name: Cursor Slot
expressions.description: The item which the player has on their cursor. This slot is always empty if player has no inventories open.
expressions.examples:
cursor slot of player is dirt
set cursor slot of player to 64 diamonds

expressions.name: Custom Model Data
expressions.description: Get/set the CustomModelData tag for an item. (Value is an integer between 0 and 99999999)
expressions.examples:
set custom model data of player's tool to 3
set {_model} to custom model data of player's tool

expressions.name: Difficulty
expressions.description: The difficulty of a world.
expressions.examples: set the difficulty of "world" to hard

expressions.name: Damage Value/Durability
expressions.description: The damage value/durability of an item.

expressions.name: Element of
expressions.description: The first, last or a random element of a set, e.g. a list variable. See also: random
expressions.examples: give a random element out of {free items::*} to the player
patterns: (0:[the] first|1:[the] last|2:[a] random|3:[the] %-number%(st|nd|rd|th)|4:[the] %-number%(st|nd|rd|th) [to] last) element [out] of %objects%

expressions.name: Enchantment Level
expressions.description: The level of a particular enchantment on an item.
expressions.examples:
player's tool is a sword of sharpness:
	message "You have a sword of sharpness %level of sharpness of the player's tool% equipped"

expressions.name: Enchantment Offer Cost
expressions.description:
The cost of an enchantment offer. This is displayed to the right of an enchantment offer.
If the cost is changed, it will always be at least 1.
This changes how many levels are required to enchant, but does not change the number of levels removed.
To change the number of levels removed, use the enchant event.
expressions.examples: set cost of enchantment offer 1 to 50

expressions.name: Item Enchantments
expressions.description: All the enchantments an item type has.
expressions.examples: clear enchantments of event-item

expressions.name: Ender Chest
expressions.description: The ender chest of a player.
expressions.examples: open the player's ender chest to the player

expressions.name: Entity Owner
expressions.description: The owner of a tameable entity, such as a horse or wolf.
expressions.examples:
set owner of target entity to player
delete owner of target entity
set {_t} to uuid of tamer of target entity

expressions.name: Exhaustion
expressions.description: The exhaustion of a player. This is mainly used to determine the rate of hunger depletion.
expressions.examples: set exhaustion of all players to 1

expressions.name: Explosion Block Yield
expressions.description:
The percentage of exploded blocks dropped in an explosion event.
When changing the yield, a value greater than 1 will function the same as using 1.
Attempting to change the yield to a value less than 0 will have no effect.
expressions.examples:
on explode:
set the explosion's block yield to 10%

expressions.name: Explosive Yield
expressions.description: The yield of an explosive (creeper, primed tnt, fireball, etc.). This is how big of an explosion is caused by the entity. Read this wiki page for more information
expressions.examples:
on spawn of a creeper:
	set the explosive yield of the event-entity to 10

expressions.name: Head location
expressions.description:
The location of an entity's head, mostly useful for players and e.g. looping blocks in the player's line of sight.
Please note that this location is only accurate for entities whose head is exactly above their center, i.e. players, endermen, zombies, skeletons, etc., but not sheep, pigs or cows.
expressions.examples:
set the block at the player's head to air
set the block in front of the player's eyes to glass
loop blocks in front of the player's head:

expressions.name: Facing
expressions.description: The facing of an entity or block, i.e. exactly north, south, east, west, up or down (unlike direction which is the exact direction, e.g. '0.5 south and 0.7 east')
expressions.examples:
# makes a bridge
loop blocks from the block below the player in the horizontal facing of the player:
	set loop-block to cobblestone

expressions.name: Fall Distance
expressions.description: The distance an entity has fallen for.
expressions.examples:
set all entities' fall distance to 10
on damage:
	send "%victim's fall distance%" to victim

expressions.name: Entity Fire Burn Duration
expressions.description: How much time an entity will be burning for.
expressions.examples: send "You will stop burning in %fire time of player%"

expressions.name: Flight Mode
expressions.description: Whether the player(s) are allowed to fly. Use Make Fly effect to force player(s) to fly.
expressions.examples:
set flight mode of player to true
send "%flying state of all players%"

expressions.name: Food Level
expressions.description: The food level of a player from 0 to 10. Has several aliases: food/hunger level/meter/bar.
expressions.examples: set the player's food level to 10

expressions.name: Formatted Date
expressions.description: Converts date to human-readable text format. By default, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z' (e.g. '2018-03-30 16:03:12 +01') will be used. For reference, see this Wikipedia article.
expressions.examples:
command /date:
	trigger:
		send "Full date: %now formatted human-readable%" to sender
		send "Short date: %now formatted as "yyyy-MM-dd"%" to sender

expressions.name: Freeze Time
expressions.description: How much time an entity has been in powdered snow for.
expressions.examples:
player's freeze time is less than 3 seconds:
	send "you're about to freeze!" to the player

expressions.name: Furnace Slot
expressions.description: A slot of a furnace, i.e. either the ore, fuel or result slot. Remember to use 'block' and not 'furnace', as 'furnace' is not an existing expression.
expressions.examples:
set the fuel slot of the clicked block to a lava bucket
set the block's ore slot to 64 iron ore
give the result of the block to the player
clear the result slot of the block

expressions.name: Game Mode
expressions.description: The gamemode of a player. (Gamemodes)
expressions.examples:
player's gamemode is survival
set the player's gamemode to creative

expressions.name: Gliding State
expressions.description: Sets of gets gliding state of player. It allows you to set gliding state of entity even if they do not have an Elytra equipped.
expressions.examples: set gliding of player to off

expressions.name: Glowing
expressions.description: Indicates if targeted entity is glowing (new 1.9 effect) or not. Glowing entities can be seen through walls.
expressions.examples: set glowing of player to true

expressions.name: Gravity
expressions.description: If entity is affected by gravity or not, i.e. if it has Minecraft 1.10+ NoGravity flag.
expressions.examples: set gravity of player off

expressions.name: Health
expressions.description: The health of a creature, e.g. a player, mob, villager, etc. The minimum value is 0, and the maximum is the creature's max health (e.g. 10 for players).
expressions.examples: message "You have %health% HP left."

expressions.name: Hidden Players
expressions.description: The players hidden from a player that were hidden using the player visibility effect.
expressions.examples: message "<light red>You are currently hiding: <light gray>%hidden players of the player%"

expressions.name: Highest Solid Block
expressions.description: Returns the highest solid block at the x and z coordinates of the world of a given location.
expressions.examples: highest block at location of arg-player

expressions.name: Hotbar Slot
expressions.description: The currently selected hotbar slot. To retrieve its number use Slot Index expression.
expressions.examples:
message "%player's current hotbar slot%"
set player's selected hotbar slot to slot 4 of player
send "index of player's current hotbar slot = 1" # second slot from the left

expressions.name: Humidity
expressions.description: Humidity of given blocks.
expressions.examples: set {_humidity} to event-block's humidity

expressions.name: Inventory
expressions.description: The inventory of a block or player. You can usually omit this expression and can directly add or remove items to/from blocks or players.
expressions.examples:
add a plank to the player's inventory
clear the player's inventory
remove 5 wool from the inventory of the clicked block

expressions.name: Inventory Holder/Viewers/Rows/Slots
expressions.description:
Gets the amount of rows/slots, viewers and holder of an inventory.

NOTE: 'Viewers' expression returns a list of players viewing the inventory. Note that a player is considered to be viewing their own inventory and internal crafting screen even when said inventory is not open.
expressions.examples:
event-inventory's amount of rows
holder of player's top inventory
{_inventory}'s viewers

expressions.name: IP
expressions.since: 1.4, 2.2-dev26 (when used in connect event), 2.3 (when used in server list ping event)
expressions.description: The IP address of a player, or the connected player in a connect event, or the pinger in a server list ping event.
expressions.examples:
ban the IP address of the player
broadcast "Banned the IP %IP of player%"

on connect:
	log "[%now%] %player% (%ip%) is connected to the server."

on server list ping:
	send "%IP-address%" to the console

expressions.name: Item Amount
expressions.description: The amount of an item stack.
expressions.examples: send "You have got %item amount of player's tool% %player's tool% in your hand!" to player

expressions.name: Item of an Entity
expressions.description: An item associated with an entity. For dropped item entities, it gets, obviously, the item that was dropped. For item frames, the item inside the frame is returned. For throwable projectiles (snowballs, enderpearls etc.),it gets the displayed item. Other entities do not have items associated with them.

expressions.name: Items In
expressions.description:
All items in an inventory. Useful for looping or storing in a list variable.
Please note that the positions of the items in the inventory are not saved, only their order is preserved.
expressions.examples:
loop all items in the player's inventory:
	loop-item is enchanted
	remove loop-item from the player
set {inventory::%uuid of player%::*} to items in the player's inventory

expressions.name: Item with CustomModelData
expressions.description: Get an item with a CustomModelData tag. (Value is an integer between 0 and 99999999)
expressions.examples:
give player a diamond sword with custom model data 2
set slot 1 of inventory of player to wooden hoe with custom model data 357

expressions.name: Item with Lore
expressions.description:
Returns the given item type with the specified lore added to it.
If multiple strings are passed, each of them will be a separate line in the lore.
expressions.examples:
set {_test} to stone with lore "line 1" and "line 2"
give {_test} to player

expressions.name: Language
expressions.description:
Currently selected game language of a player. The value of the language is not defined properly.
The vanilla Minecraft client will use lowercase language / country pairs separated by an underscore, but custom resource packs may use any format they wish.
expressions.examples: message player's current language

expressions.name: Last Attacker
expressions.description: The last block or entity that attacked an entity.
expressions.examples: send "%last attacker of event-entity%"

expressions.name: Last Color
expressions.description: The colors used at the end of a string. The colors of the returned string will be formatted with their symbols.
expressions.examples: set {_color} to the last colors of "<red>hey<blue>yo"

expressions.name: Last Damage
expressions.description: The last damage that was done to an entity. Note that changing it doesn't deal more/less damage.
expressions.examples: set last damage of event-entity to 2

expressions.name: Last Damage Cause
expressions.description: Cause of last damage done to an entity
expressions.examples: set last damage cause of event-entity to fire tick

expressions.name: Last/First Login Time
expressions.description: When a player last/first logged in the server. 'last login' requires paper to get the last login, otherwise it will get the last time they were seen on the server.
expressions.examples:
command /onlinefor:
	trigger:
		send "You have been online for %difference between player's last login and now%."
		send "You first joined the server %difference between player's first login and now% ago."

expressions.name: Last Resource Pack Response
expressions.description: Returns the last resource pack response received from a player.
expressions.examples: if player's last resource pack response is deny or download fail:

expressions.name: Leash Holder
expressions.description: The leash holder of a living entity.
expressions.examples: set {_example} to the leash holder of the target mob

expressions.name: Length
expressions.description: The length of a text, in number of characters.
expressions.examples: set {_l} to length of the string argument

expressions.name: Level
expressions.description: The level of a player.
expressions.examples:
reduce the victim's level by 1
set the player's level to 0

expressions.name: Level Progress
expressions.description: The player's progress in reaching the next level, this represents the experience bar in the game. Please note that this value is between 0 and 1 (e.g. 0.5 = half experience bar). Changing this value can cause the player's level to change if the resulting level progess is negative or larger than 1, e.g. increase the player's level progress by 0.5 will make the player gain a level if their progress was more than 50%.
expressions.examples:
# use the exp bar as mana
on rightclick with a blaze rod:
	player's level progress is larger than 0.2
	shoot a fireball from the player
	reduce the player's level progress by 0.2
every 2 seconds:
	loop all players:
		level progress of loop-player is smaller than 0.9:
			increase level progress of the loop-player by 0.1
		else:
			set level progress of the loop-player to 0.99
on xp spawn:
	cancel event

expressions.name: Light Level
expressions.description:
Gets the light level at a certain location which ranges from 0 to 15.
It can be separated into sunlight (15 = direct sunlight, 1-14 = indirect) and block light (torches, glowstone, etc.). The total light level of a block is the maximum of the two different light types.
expressions.examples:
# set vampire players standing in bright sunlight on fire
every 5 seconds:
	loop all players:
		{vampire::%uuid of loop-player%} is true
		sunlight level at the loop-player is greater than 10
		ignite the loop-player for 5 seconds

expressions.name: Location
expressions.description: The location of a block or entity. This not only represents the x, y and z coordinates of the location but also includes the world and the direction an entity is looking (e.g. teleporting to a saved location will make the teleported entity face the same saved direction every time). Please note that the location of an entity is at it's feet, use head location to get the location of the head.
expressions.examples:
set {home::%uuid of player%} to the location of the player
message "You home was set to %player's location% in %player's world%."

expressions.name: Lore
expressions.description: An item's lore.
expressions.examples: set the 1st line of the item's lore to "<orange>Excalibur 2.0"

expressions.name: Max Durability
expressions.description: The maximum durability of an item.
expressions.examples:
maximum durability of diamond sword
if max durability of player's tool is not 0: # Item is damageable

expressions.name: Maximum Freeze Time
expressions.description: The maximum amount of time an entity can spend in powdered snow before taking damage.
expressions.examples:
difference between player's freeze time and player's max freeze time is less than 1 second:
	send "you're about to freeze!" to the player

expressions.name: Max Health
expressions.description: The maximum health of an entity, e.g. 10 for a player.
expressions.examples:
on join:
	set the maximum health of the player to 100
spawn a giant
set the last spawned entity's max health to 1000

expressions.name: Max Minecart Speed
expressions.description: The maximum speed of a minecart.
expressions.examples:
on right click on minecart:
	set max minecart speed of event-entity to 1

expressions.name: Max Players
expressions.description: The count of max players. This can be changed in a server list ping event only. 'real max players' returns the real count of max players of the server and can be modified on Paper 1.16 or later.
expressions.examples:
on server list ping:
	set the max players count to (online players count + 1)

expressions.name: Maximum Stack Size
expressions.description: The maximum stack size of the specified material, e.g. 64 for torches, 16 for buckets, and 1 for swords.
expressions.examples: send "You can only pick up %max stack size of player's tool% of %type of (player's tool)%" to player

expressions.name: Metadata
expressions.description: Metadata is a way to store temporary data on entities, blocks and more that disappears after a server restart.
expressions.examples:
set metadata value "healer" of player to true
broadcast "%metadata value ""healer"" of player%"
clear metadata value "healer" of player

expressions.name: Middle of Location
expressions.description: Returns the middle/center of a location. In other words, returns the middle of the X, Z coordinates and the floor value of the Y coordinate of a location.
expressions.examples:
command /stuck:
	executable by: players
	trigger:
		teleport player to the center of player's location
		send "You're no longer stuck."

expressions.name: Minecart Derailed / Flying Velocity
expressions.description: The velocity of a minecart as soon as it has been derailed or as soon as it starts flying.
expressions.examples:
on right click on minecart:
	set derailed velocity of event-entity to vector 2, 10, 2

expressions.name: Moon Phase
expressions.description: The current moon phase of a world.
expressions.examples:
if moon phase of player's world is full moon:
	send "Watch for the wolves!"

expressions.name: Name / Display Name / Tab List Name
expressions.since: before 2.1, 2.2-dev20 (inventory name), 2.4 (non-living entity support, changeable inventory name), 2.7 (worlds)
expressions.description:
Represents the Minecraft account, display or tab list name of a player, or the custom name of an item, entity, block, inventory, gamerule or world.
  • Players
    • Name: The Minecraft account name of the player. Can't be changed, but 'display name' can be changed.
    • Display Name: The name of the player that is displayed in messages. This name can be changed freely and can include color codes, and is shared among all plugins (e.g. chat plugins will use the display name).
  • Entities
    • Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed. But for living entities, the players will have to target the entity to see its name tag. For non-living entities, the name will not be visible at all. To prevent this, use 'display name'.
    • Display Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed, which will also enable custom name visibility of the entity so name tag of the entity will be visible always.
  • Items
    • Name and Display Name: The custom name of the item (not the Minecraft locale name). Can be changed.
  • Inventories
    • Name and Display Name: The name/title of the inventory. Changing name of an inventory means opening the same inventory with the same contents but with a different name to its current viewers.
  • Gamerules (1.13+)
    • Name: The name of the gamerule. Cannot be changed.
  • Worlds
    • Name: The name of the world. Cannot be changed.
expressions.examples:
on join:
	player has permission "name.red"
	set the player's display name to "<red>[admin] <gold>%name of player%"
	set the player's tab list name to "<green>%player's name%"
set the name of the player's tool to "Legendary Sword of Awesomeness"

expressions.name: Name / Display Name / Tab List Name
expressions.since: before 2.1, 2.2-dev20 (inventory name), 2.4 (non-living entity support, changeable inventory name), 2.7 (worlds)
expressions.description:
Represents the Minecraft account, display or tab list name of a player, or the custom name of an item, entity, block, inventory, gamerule or world.
  • Players
    • Name: The Minecraft account name of the player. Can't be changed, but 'display name' can be changed.
    • Display Name: The name of the player that is displayed in messages. This name can be changed freely and can include color codes, and is shared among all plugins (e.g. chat plugins will use the display name).
  • Entities
    • Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed. But for living entities, the players will have to target the entity to see its name tag. For non-living entities, the name will not be visible at all. To prevent this, use 'display name'.
    • Display Name: The custom name of the entity. Can be changed, which will also enable custom name visibility of the entity so name tag of the entity will be visible always.
  • Items
    • Name and Display Name: The custom name of the item (not the Minecraft locale name). Can be changed.
  • Inventories
    • Name and Display Name: The name/title of the inventory. Changing name of an inventory means opening the same inventory with the same contents but with a different name to its current viewers.
  • Gamerules (1.13+)
    • Name: The name of the gamerule. Cannot be changed.
  • Worlds
    • Name: The name of the world. Cannot be changed.
expressions.examples:
on join:
	player has permission "name.red"
	set the player's display name to "<red>[admin] <gold>%name of player%"
	set the player's tab list name to "<green>%player's name%"
set the name of the player's tool to "Legendary Sword of Awesomeness"

expressions.name: Named Item/Inventory
expressions.description: Directly names an item/inventory, useful for defining a named item/inventory in a script. If you want to (re)name existing items/inventories you can either use this expression or use set name of <item/inventory> to <text>.
expressions.examples:
give a diamond sword of sharpness 100 named "<gold>Excalibur" to the player
set tool of player to the player's tool named "<gold>Wand"
set the name of the player's tool to "<gold>Wand"
open hopper inventory named "Magic Hopper" to player

expressions.name: No Damage Ticks
expressions.description: The number of ticks that an entity is invulnerable to damage for.
expressions.examples:
on damage:
	set victim's invulnerability ticks to 20 #Victim will not take damage for the next second

expressions.name: Online Player Count
expressions.description: The amount of online players. This can be changed in a server list ping event only to show fake online player amount. 'real online player count' always returns the real count of online players and can't be changed. Fake online player count requires PaperSpigot 1.12.2+.
expressions.examples:
on server list ping:
	# This will make the max players count 5 if there are 4 players online.
	set the fake max players count to (online players count + 1)

expressions.name: Opened Inventory
expressions.description:
Return the currently opened inventory of a player.
If no inventory is open, it returns the own player's crafting inventory.
expressions.examples: set slot 1 of player's current inventory to diamond sword

expressions.name: Passenger
expressions.description: The passenger of a vehicle, or the rider of a mob. For 1.11.2 and above, it returns a list of passengers and you can use all changers in it. See also: vehicle
expressions.examples:
#for 1.11 and lower
passenger of the minecart is a creeper or a cow
the saddled pig's passenger is a player
#for 1.11.2+
passengers of the minecart contains a creeper or a cow
the boat's passenger contains a pig
add a cow and a zombie to passengers of last spawned boat
set passengers of player's vehicle to a pig and a horse
remove all pigs from player's vehicle
clear passengers of boat

expressions.name: All Permissions
expressions.description: Returns all permissions of the defined player(s). Note that the modifications to resulting list do not actually change permissions.
expressions.examples: set {_permissions::*} to all permissions of the player

expressions.name: Pickup Delay
expressions.description: The amount of time before a dropped item can be picked up by an entity.
expressions.examples:
drop diamond sword at {_location} without velocity
set pickup delay of last dropped item to 5 seconds

expressions.name: Ping
expressions.description: Pings of players, as Minecraft server knows them. Note that they will almost certainly be different from the ones you'd get from using ICMP echo requests. This expression is only supported on some server software (PaperSpigot).
expressions.examples:
command /ping <player=%player%>:
	trigger:
		send "%arg-1%'s ping is %arg-1's ping%"

expressions.name: Player List Header and Footer
expressions.description: The message above and below the player list in the tab menu.
expressions.examples:
set all players' tab list header to "Welcome to the Server!"
send "%the player's tab list header%" to player
reset all players' tab list header

expressions.name: Player Protocol Version
expressions.description: Player's protocol version. For more information and list of protocol versions visit wiki.vg.
expressions.examples:
command /protocolversion &ltplayer&gt:
	trigger:
		send "Protocol version of %arg-1%: %protocol version of arg-1%"

expressions.name: View Distance
expressions.description:
The view distance of a player as set by the server. Can be changed.
NOTE: This is the view distance sent by the server to the player.
This has nothing to do with client side view distance settings
NOTE: This may not work on some versions (such as MC 1.14.x).
The return value in this case will be the view distance set in system.properties.
expressions.examples:
set view distance of player to 10
set {_view} to view distance of player
reset view distance of all players
add 2 to view distance of player

expressions.name: Player Weather
expressions.description: The weather for a player.
expressions.examples:
set weather of arg-player to rainy
reset player's weather
if arg-player's weather is rainy

expressions.name: Potion Effects
expressions.description:
Represents the active potion effects of entities and itemtypes.
You can clear all potion effects of an entity/itemtype and add/remove a potion effect/type to/from an entity/itemtype.
Do note you will not be able to clear the base potion effects of a potion item. In that case, just set the item to a water bottle.
When adding a potion effect type (rather than a potion effect), it will default to 15 seconds with tier 1.
expressions.examples:
set {_p::*} to active potion effects of player
clear all the potion effects of player
clear all the potion effects of player's tool
add potion effects of player to potion effects of player's tool
add speed to potion effects of target entity
remove speed and night vision from potion effects of player

expressions.name: Projectile Bounce State
expressions.description: A projectile's bounce state.
expressions.examples:
on projectile hit:
	set projectile bounce mode of event-projectile to true

expressions.name: Projectile Critical State
expressions.description: A projectile's critical state. The only currently accepted projectiles are arrows and tridents.
expressions.examples:
on shoot:
	event-projectile is an arrow
	set projectile critical mode of event-projectile to true

expressions.name: Redstone Block Power
expressions.description: Power of a redstone block
expressions.examples:
if redstone power of targeted block is 15:
	send "This block is very powerful!"

expressions.name: Remaining Air
expressions.description: How much time a player has left underwater before starting to drown.
expressions.examples:
player's remaining air is less than 3 seconds:
	send "hurry, get to the surface!" to the player

expressions.name: Rounding
expressions.description: Rounds numbers normally, up (ceiling) or down (floor) respectively.
expressions.examples:
set {var} to rounded health of player
set line 1 of the block to rounded "%(1.5 * player's level)%"
add rounded down argument to the player's health

expressions.name: Saturation
expressions.description: The saturation of a player. If used in a player event, it can be omitted and will default to event-player.
expressions.examples: set saturation of player to 20

expressions.name: Scoreboard Tags
expressions.description: Scoreboard tags are simple list of texts stored directly in the data of an entity. So this is a Minecraft related thing, not Bukkit, so the tags will not get removed when the server stops. You can visit visit Minecraft Wiki for more info. This is changeable and valid for any type of entity. Also you can use use the Has Scoreboard Tag condition to check whether an entity has the given tags. Requires Minecraft 1.11+ (actually added in 1.9 to the game, but added in 1.11 to Spigot).

expressions.name: Sea Level
expressions.description: Gets the sea level of a world.
expressions.examples: send "The sea level in your world is %sea level in player's world%"

expressions.name: Sea Pickles
expressions.description: An expression to obtain or modify data relating to the pickles of a sea pickle block.
expressions.examples:
on block break:
	type of block is sea pickle
	send "Wow! This stack of sea pickles contained %event-block's sea pickle count% pickles!"
	send "It could've contained a maximum of %event-block's maximum sea pickle count% pickles!"
	send "It had to have contained at least %event-block's minimum sea pickle count% pickles!"
	cancel event
	set event-block's sea pickle count to event-block's maximum sea pickle count
	send "This bad boy is going to hold so many pickles now!!"

expressions.name: World Seed
expressions.description: The seed of given world. Note that it will be returned as Minecraft internally treats seeds, not as you specified it in world configuration.
expressions.examples: broadcast "Seed: %seed of player's world%"

expressions.name: Server Icon
expressions.description: Icon of the server in the server list. Can be set to an icon that loaded using the load server icon effect, or can be reset to the default icon in a server list ping. 'default server icon' returns the default server icon (server-icon.png) always and cannot be changed.
expressions.examples:
on script load:
	set {server-icons::default} to the default server icon

expressions.name: Sign Text
expressions.description: A line of text on a sign. Can be changed, but remember that there is a 16 character limit per line (including color codes that use 2 characters each).
expressions.examples:
on rightclick on sign:
	line 2 of the clicked block is "[Heal]":
		heal the player
	set line 3 to "%player%"

expressions.name: Player Skull
expressions.description: Gets a skull item representing a player. Skulls for other entities are provided by the aliases.
expressions.examples:
give the victim's skull to the attacker
set the block at the entity to the entity's skull

expressions.name: Slot Index
expressions.description: Index of an an inventory slot. Other types of slots may or may not have indices. Note that comparing slots with numbers is also possible; if index of slot is same as the number, comparisonsucceeds. This expression is mainly for the cases where you must for some reason save the slot numbers.
expressions.examples:
if index of event-slot is 10:
	send "You bought a pie!"

expressions.name: Spawn
expressions.description: The spawn point of a world.
expressions.examples:
teleport all players to spawn
set the spawn point of "world" to the player's location

expressions.name: Spawner Type
expressions.description: Retrieves, sets, or resets the spawner's entity type

expressions.name: Spectator Target
expressions.description: Grabs the spectator target entity of the players.
expressions.examples:
on player start spectating of player:
	message "&c%spectator target% currently has %{game::kills::%spectator target%}% kills!" to the player

on player stop spectating:
	past spectator target was a zombie
	set spectator target to the nearest skeleton

expressions.name: Speed
expressions.description:
A player's walking or flying speed. Both can be changed, but values must be between -1 and 1 (excessive values will be changed to -1 or 1 respectively). Negative values reverse directions.
Please note that changing a player's speed will change their FOV just like potions do.
expressions.examples:
set the player's walk speed to 1
increase the argument's fly speed by 0.1

expressions.name: Target
expressions.description:
For players this is the entity at the crosshair.
For mobs and experience orbs this is the entity they are attacking/following (if any).
expressions.examples:
on entity target:
	if entity's target is a player:
		send "You're being followed by an %entity%!" to target of entity

reset target of entity # Makes the entity target-less
delete targeted entity of player # for players it will delete the target
delete target of last spawned zombie # for entities it will make them target-less

expressions.name: Temperature
expressions.description: Temperature at given block.
expressions.examples: message "%temperature of the targeted block%"

expressions.name: Time
expressions.description: The time of a world.
expressions.examples:
time in world is between 18:00 and 6:00:
	broadcast "It's night-time, watch out for monsters!"

expressions.name: Time Played
expressions.description: The amount of time a player has played for on the server. This info is stored in the player's statistics in the main world's data folder. Changing this will also change the player's stats which can be views in the client's statistics menu. Using this expression on offline players on Minecraft 1.14 and below will return nothing <none>.
expressions.examples:
set {_t} to time played of player
if player's time played is greater than 10 minutes:
	give player a diamond sword

set player's time played to 0 seconds

expressions.name: Time Since
expressions.description: The time that has passed since a date. If the given date is in the future, a value will not be returned.
expressions.examples: send "%time since 5 minecraft days ago% has passed since 5 minecraft days ago!" to player

expressions.name: Former/Future State
expressions.description: Represents the value of an expression before an event happened or the value it will have directly after the event, e.g. the old or new level respectively in a level change event. Note: The past, future and present states of an expression are sometimes called 'time states' of an expression. Note 2: If you don't specify whether to use the past or future state of an expression that has different values, its default value will be used which is usually the value after the event.
expressions.examples:
on teleport:
	former world was "world_nether" # or 'world was'
	world will be "world" # or 'world after the event is'
on tool change:
	past tool is an axe
	the tool after the event will be air
on weather change:
	set {weather::%world%::old} to past weather
	set {weather::%world%::current} to the new weather

expressions.name: Tool
expressions.description: The item an entity is holding in their main or off hand.
expressions.examples:
player's tool is a pickaxe
player's off hand tool is a shield
set tool of all players to a diamond sword
set offhand tool of target entity to a bow

expressions.name: Total Experience
expressions.description:
The total experience, in points, of players or experience orbs.
Adding to a player's experience will trigger Mending, but setting their experience will not.
expressions.examples:
set total experience of player to 100

add 100 to player's experience

if player's total experience is greater than 100:
	set player's total experience to 0
	give player 1 diamond

expressions.name: Type of
expressions.description:
Type of a block, item, entity, inventory or potion effect.
Types of items, blocks and block datas are item types similar to them but have amounts
of one, no display names and, on Minecraft 1.13 and newer versions, are undamaged.
Types of entities and inventories are entity types and inventory types known to Skript.
Types of potion effects are potion effect types.
expressions.examples:
on rightclick on an entity:
	message "This is a %type of clicked entity%!"

expressions.name: Unbreakable Items
expressions.description: Creates unbreakable copies of given items.
expressions.examples: unbreakable iron sword #Creates unbreakable iron sword

expressions.name: Unix Date
expressions.description: Converts given Unix timestamp to a date. The Unix timespan represents the number of seconds elapsed since 1 January 1970.
expressions.examples: unix date of 946684800 #1 January 2000 12:00 AM (UTC Time)

expressions.name: Unix Timestamp
expressions.description: Converts given date to Unix timestamp. This is roughly how many seconds have elapsed since 1 January 1970.
expressions.examples: unix timestamp of now

expressions.name: UUID
expressions.description: The UUID of a player, entity or world. In the future there will be an option to use a player's UUID instead of the name in variable names (i.e. when %player% is used), but for now this can be used. Please note that this expression does not work for offline players if you are under 1.8!
expressions.examples:
# prevents people from joining the server if they use the name of a player
# who has played on this server at least once since this script has been added
on login:
	if {uuid::%name of player%} exists:
		{uuid::%name of player%} is not uuid of player
		kick player due to "Someone with your name has played on this server before"
	else:
		set {uuid::%name of player%} to uuid of player

expressions.name: Vectors - Length
expressions.description: Gets or sets the length of a vector.
expressions.examples:
send "%standard length of vector 1, 2, 3%"
set {_v} to vector 1, 2, 3
set standard length of {_v} to 2
send "%standard length of {_v}%"

expressions.name: Vectors - Squared Length
expressions.description: Gets the squared length of a vector.
expressions.examples: send "%squared length of vector 1, 2, 3%"

expressions.name: Vectors - XYZ Component
expressions.description: Gets or changes the x, y or z component of a vector.

expressions.name: Vehicle
expressions.description: The vehicle an entity is in, if any. This can actually be any entity, e.g. spider jockeys are skeletons that ride on a spider, so the spider is the 'vehicle' of the skeleton. See also: passenger
expressions.examples: vehicle of the player is a minecart

expressions.name: Vectors - Velocity
expressions.description: Gets or changes velocity of an entity.
expressions.examples: set player's velocity to {_v}

expressions.name: Weather
expressions.description: The weather in the given or the current world.
expressions.examples:
set weather to clear
weather in "world" is rainy

expressions.name: World
expressions.description: The world the event occurred in.
expressions.examples:
world is "world_nether"
teleport the player to the world's spawn
set the weather in the player's world to rain
set {_world} to world of event-chunk

expressions.name: World Environment
expressions.description: The environment of a world
expressions.examples:
if environment of player's world is nether:
	apply fire resistance to player for 10 minutes

expressions.name: Yaw / Pitch
expressions.description: The yaw or pitch of a location or vector.
expressions.examples:
log "%player%: %location of player%, %player's yaw%, %player's pitch%" to "playerlocs.log"
set {_yaw} to yaw of player
set {_p} to pitch of target entity

expressions.name: Region Members & Owners
expressions.description: A list of members or owners of a region. This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
expressions.examples:
on entering of a region:
	message "You're entering %region% whose owners are %owners of region%"

expressions.name: Regions At
expressions.description: All regions at a particular location. This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
expressions.examples:
On click on a sign:
	line 1 of the clicked block is "[region info]"
	set {_regions::*} to regions at the clicked block
	if {_regions::*} is empty:
		message "No regions exist at this sign."
	else:
		message "Regions containing this sign: <gold>%{_regions::*}%<r>."

expressions.name: Money
expressions.description: How much virtual money a player has (can be changed).
expressions.examples:
message "You have %player's money%" # the currency name will be added automatically
remove 20$ from the player's balance # replace '$' by whatever currency you use
add 200 to the player's account # or omit the currency altogether

expressions.name: Prefix/Suffix
expressions.description: The prefix or suffix as defined in the server's chat plugin.
expressions.examples:
on chat:
	cancel event
	broadcast "%player's prefix%%player's display name%%player's suffix%: %message%" to the player's world

set the player's prefix to "[<red>Admin<reset>] "

expressions.name: Group
expressions.description: The primary group or all groups of a player. This expression requires Vault and a compatible permissions plugin to be installed.
expressions.examples:
on join:
	broadcast "%group of player%" # this is the player's primary group
	broadcast "%groups of player%" # this is all of the player's groups

expressions.name: Arithmetic
expressions.description: Arithmetic expressions, e.g. 1 + 2, (health of player - 2) / 3, etc.
expressions.examples:
set the player's health to 10 - the player's health
loop (argument + 2) / 5 times:
	message "Two useless numbers: %loop-num * 2 - 5%, %2^loop-num - 1%"
message "You have %health of player * 2% half hearts of HP!"

expressions.name: Entities
expressions.description: All entities in all worlds, in a specific world, in a chunk or in a radius around a certain location, e.g. all players, all creepers in the player's world, or players in radius 100 of the player.
expressions.examples:
kill all creepers in the player's world
send "Psst!" to all players within 100 meters of the player
give a diamond to all ops
heal all tamed wolves in radius 2000 around {town center}
delete all monsters in chunk at player
patterns: [(all [[of] the]|the)] entities of type[s] %entitydatas% in radius %number% (of|around) %location%

expressions.name: Creature/Entity/Player/Projectile/Villager/Powered Creeper/etc.
expressions.description:
The entity involved in an event (an entity is a player, a creature or an inanimate object like ignited TNT, a dropped item or an arrow).
You can use the specific type of the entity that's involved in the event, e.g. in a 'death of a creeper' event you can use 'the creeper' instead of 'the entity'.
expressions.examples:
give a diamond sword of sharpness 3 to the player
kill the creeper
kill all powered creepers in the wolf's world
projectile is an arrow

expressions.name: X of Item
expressions.description: An expression to be able to use a certain amount of items where the amount can be any expression. Please note that this expression is not stable and might be replaced in the future.
expressions.examples: give level of player of pickaxes to the player

events.name: At Time
events.description: An event that occurs at a given minecraft time in every world or only in specific worlds.
events.examples:
at 18:00
at 7am in "world"

events.name: On Break / Mine
events.description: Called when a block is broken by a player. If you use 'on mine', only events where the broken block dropped something will call the trigger.
events.examples:
on mine:
on break of stone:
on mine of any ore:
on break of chest[facing=north]:
on break of potatoes[age=7]:

events.name: On Burn
events.description: Called when a block is destroyed by fire.
events.examples:
on burn:
on burn of wood, fences, or chests:
on burn of oak_log[axis=y]:

events.name: On Place
events.description: Called when a player places a block.
events.examples:
on place:
on place of a furnace, workbench or chest:
on break of chest[type=right] or chest[type=left]

events.name: On Fade
events.description: Called when a block 'fades away', e.g. ice or snow melts.
events.examples:
on fade of snow or ice:
on fade of snow[layers=2]

events.name: On Form
events.description: Called when a block is created, but not by a player, e.g. snow forms due to snowfall, water freezes in cold biomes. This isn't called when block spreads (mushroom growth, water physics etc.), as it has its own event (see spread event).
events.examples:
on form of snow:
on form of a mushroom:

events.name: On Book Edit
events.description: Called when a player edits a book.
events.examples: on book edit:

events.name: On Book Sign
events.description: Called when a player signs a book.
events.examples: on book sign:

events.name: On Click
events.description:
Called when a user clicks on a block, an entity or air with or without an item in their hand.
Please note that rightclick events with an empty hand while not looking at a block are not sent to the server, so there's no way to detect them.
Also note that a leftclick on an entity is an attack and thus not covered by the 'click' event, but the 'damage' event.
events.examples:
on click:
on rightclick holding a fishing rod:
on leftclick on a stone or obsidian:
on rightclick on a creeper:
on click with a sword:

events.name: On Command
events.description: Called when a player enters a command (not necessarily a Skript command) but you can check if command is a skript command, see Is a Skript command condition.
events.examples:
on command:
on command "/stop":
on command "pm Njol ":

events.name: On Damage
events.description: Called when an entity receives damage, e.g. by an attack from another entity, lava, fire, drowning, fall, suffocation, etc.
events.examples:
on damage:
on damage of a player:
on damage of player by zombie:

events.name: On Death
events.description: Called when a living entity (including players) dies.
events.examples:
on death:
on death of player:
on death of a wither or ender dragon:
	broadcast "A %entity% has been slain in %world%!"

events.name: On Spawn
events.description: Called when an entity spawns (excluding players).
events.examples:
on spawn of a zombie:
on spawn of an ender dragon:
	broadcast "A dragon has been sighted in %world%!"

events.name: On Enderman/Sheep/Silverfish/Falling Block
events.description: Called when an enderman places or picks up a block, a sheep eats grass, a silverfish boops into/out of a block or a falling block lands and turns into a block respectively.
events.examples:
on sheep eat:
	kill event-entity
	broadcast "A sheep stole some grass!"

on falling block land:
	event-entity is a falling dirt
	cancel event

events.name: On Target
events.description: Called when a mob starts/stops following/attacking another entity, usually a player.
events.examples:
on entity target:
	target is a player

events.name: On Experience Change
events.description: Called when a player's experience changes.
events.examples:
on level progress change:
	set {_xp} to event-experience
	broadcast "%{_xp}%"

events.name: On Experience Spawn
events.description:
Called whenever experience is about to spawn.
Please note that this event will not fire for xp orbs spawned by plugins (including Skript) with Bukkit.
events.examples:
on xp spawn:
	world is "minigame_world"
	cancel event

events.name: On Firework Explode
events.description: Called when a firework explodes.
events.examples:
on firework explode
on firework exploding colored red, light green and black
on firework explosion colored light green:
	broadcast "A firework colored %colors% was exploded at %location%!"

events.name: On First Join
events.description: Called when a player joins the server for the first time.
events.examples:
on first join:
	broadcast "Welcome %player% to the server!"

events.name: On Gamemode Change
events.description: Called when a player's gamemode changes.
events.examples:
on gamemode change:
on gamemode change to adventure:

events.name: On Grow
events.description: Called when a tree, giant mushroom or plant grows to next stage.
events.examples:
on grow:
on grow of a tree:
on grow of a huge jungle tree:

events.name: On Dispense
events.description: Called when a dispenser dispenses an item.
events.examples:
on dispense of iron block:
	send "that'd be 19.99 please!"

events.name: On Item Spawn
events.description: Called whenever an item stack is spawned in a world, e.g. as drop of a block or mob, a player throwing items out of their inventory, or a dispenser dispensing an item (not shooting it).
events.examples:
on item spawn of iron sword:
	broadcast "Someone dropped an iron sword!"

events.name: On Drop
events.description: Called when a player drops an item from their inventory, or an entity drops an item, such as a chicken laying an egg.

events.name: On Prepare Craft
events.description: Called just before displaying crafting result to player. Note that setting the result item might or might not work due to Bukkit bugs.
events.examples: on preparing craft of torch:

events.name: On Craft
events.description: Called when a player crafts an item.
events.examples: on craft:

events.name: On Pick Up
events.description: Called when a player/entity picks up an item. Please note that the item is still on the ground when this event is called.
events.examples:
on pick up:
on entity pickup of wheat:

events.name: On Consume
events.description: Called when a player is done eating/drinking something, e.g. an apple, bread, meat, milk or a potion.
events.examples: on consume:

events.name: On Inventory Click
events.description: Called when clicking on inventory slot.
events.examples:
on inventory click:
	if event-item is stone:
		give player 1 stone
		remove 20$ from player's balance

events.name: On Item Despawn
events.description: Called when an item is about to be despawned from the world, usually 5 minutes after it was dropped.
events.examples:
on item despawn of diamond:
	send "Not my precious!"
	cancel event

events.name: On Item Merge
events.description: Called when dropped items merge into a single stack. event-entity will be the entity which is trying to merge, and future event-entity will be the entity which is being merged into.
events.examples:
on item merge of gold blocks:
	cancel event

events.name: On Level Change
events.description: Called when a player's level changes, e.g. by gathering experience or by enchanting something.
events.examples: on level change:

events.name: On Move
events.description:
Called when a player or entity moves.
NOTE: Move event will only be called when the entity/player moves position, not orientation (ie: looking around).
NOTE: These events can be performance heavy as they are called quite often.
If you use these events, and later remove them, a server restart is recommended to clear registered events from Skript.

events.name: On Pressure Plate / Trip
events.description: Called when a player steps on a pressure plate or tripwire respectively.
events.examples: on step on pressure plate:

events.name: On Move On
events.description:
Called when a player moves onto a certain type of block.
Please note that using this event can cause lag if there are many players online.
events.examples:
on walking on dirt or grass:
on stepping on stone:

events.name: Periodical
events.description: An event that is called periodically.
events.examples:
every 2 seconds:
every minecraft hour:
every tick: # can cause lag depending on the code inside the event
every minecraft days:

events.name: Periodical
events.description: An event that is called periodically.
events.examples:
every 2 seconds in "world":
every minecraft hour in "flatworld":
every tick in "world": # can cause lag depending on the code inside the event
every minecraft days in "plots":

events.name: On Block Growth
events.description: Called when a crop grows. Alternative to new form of generic grow event.
events.examples: on crop growth:

events.name: On Player Chunk Enters
events.description: Called when a player enters a chunk. Note that this event is based on 'player move' event, and may be called frequent internally.
events.examples:
on player enters a chunk:
	send "You entered a chunk: %past event-chunk% -&amp;amp;amp;gt; %event-chunk%!" to player

events.name: On Resource Pack Request Response
events.description: Called when a player takes action on a resource pack request sent via the send resource pack effect. The resource pack condition can be used to check the resource pack state. This event will be triggered once when the player accepts or declines the resource pack request, and once when the resource pack is successfully installed or failed to download.
events.examples:
on resource pack request response:
	if the resource pack was declined or failed to download:

on resource pack deny:
	kick the player due to "You have to install the resource pack to play in this server!"

events.name: On Script Load/Unload
events.description:
Called directly after the trigger is loaded, or directly before the whole script is unloaded.
The keyword 'async' indicates the trigger can be ran asynchronously,
events.examples:
on load:
	set {running::%script%} to true
on unload:
	set {running::%script%} to false

events.name: On Server Start/Stop
events.description: Called when the server starts or stops (actually, when Skript starts or stops, so a /reload will trigger these events as well).
events.examples:
on skript start:
on server stop:

events.name: On Spectate
events.description: Called with a player starts, stops or swaps spectating an entity.
events.examples: on player start spectating of a zombie:

events.name: On Weather Change
events.description: Called when a world's weather changes.
events.examples:
on weather change:
on weather change to sunny:

events.name: On Can Build Check
events.description: Called when a player rightclicks on a block while holding a block or a placeable item. You can either cancel the event to prevent the block from being built, or uncancel it to allow it. Please note that the data value of the block to be placed is not available in this event, only its ID.
events.examples:
on block can build check:
	cancel event

events.name: On Block Damage
events.description: Called when a player starts to break a block. You can usually just use the leftclick event for this.

events.name: On Flow
events.description: Called when a blocks flows or teleports to another block. This not only applies to water and lava, but teleporting dragon eggs as well.

events.name: On Ignition
events.description: Called when a block starts burning, i.e. a fire block is placed next to it and this block is flammable. The burn event will be called when the block is about do be destroyed by the fire.

events.name: On Physics
events.description: Called when a physics check is done on a block. By cancelling this event you can prevent some things from happening, e.g. sand falling, dirt turning into grass, torches dropping if their supporting block is destroyed, etc.Please note that using this event might cause quite some lag since it gets called extremely often.
events.examples:
# prevents sand from falling
on block physics:
	block is sand
	cancel event

events.name: On Piston Extend
events.description: Called when a piston is about to extend.
events.examples:
on piston extend:
	broadcast "A piston is extending!"

events.name: On Piston Retract
events.description: Called when a piston is about to retract.
events.examples:
on piston retract:
	broadcast "A piston is retracting!"

events.name: On Redstone
events.description: Called when the redstone current of a block changes. This event is of not much use yet.
events.examples:
on redstone change:
	send "someone is using redstone" to console

events.name: On Spread
events.description: Called when a new block forms as a result of a block that can spread, e.g. water or mushrooms.
events.examples: on spread:

events.name: On Chunk Load
events.description: Called when a chunk loads. The chunk might or might not contain mobs when it's loaded.
events.examples: on chunk load:

events.name: On Chunk Generate
events.description: Called after a new chunk was generated.
events.examples: on chunk generate:

events.name: On Chunk Unload
events.description: Called when a chunk is unloaded due to not being near any player.
events.examples: on chunk unload:

events.name: On Creeper Power
events.description: Called when a creeper is struck by lighting and gets powered. Cancel the event to prevent the creeper from being powered.
events.examples: on creeper power:

events.name: On Zombie Break Door
events.description: Called when a zombie is done breaking a wooden door. Can be cancelled to prevent the zombie from breaking the door.
events.examples: on zombie breaking a wood door:

events.name: On Combust
events.description: Called when an entity is set on fire, e.g. by fire or lava, a fireball, or by standing in direct sunlight (zombies, skeletons).
events.examples: on combust:

events.name: On Explode
events.description: Called when an entity (a primed TNT or a creeper) explodes.
events.examples: on explosion:

events.name: On Portal Enter
events.description: Called when an entity enters a nether portal or an end portal. Please note that this event will be fired many times for a nether portal.
events.examples: on portal enter:

events.name: On Heal
events.description: Called when an entity is healed, e.g. by eating (players), being fed (pets), or by the effect of a potion of healing (overworld mobs) or harm (nether mobs).
events.examples: on heal:

events.name: On Tame
events.description: Called when a player tames a wolf or ocelot. Can be cancelled to prevent the entity from being tamed.
events.examples: on tame:

events.name: On Explosion Prime
events.description: Called when an explosive is primed, i.e. an entity will explode shortly. Creepers can abort the explosion if the player gets too far away, while TNT will explode for sure after a short time.
events.examples: on explosion prime:

events.name: On Hunger Meter Change
events.description: Called when the hunger bar of a player changes, i.e. either increases by eating or decreases over time.
events.examples: on food bar change:

events.name: On Fuel Burn
events.description: Called when a furnace burns an item from its fuel slot.
events.examples: on fuel burning:

events.name: On Smelt
events.description: Called when a furnace smelts an item in its ore slot.
events.examples: on smelt:

events.name: On Leaves Decay
events.description: Called when a leaf block decays due to not being connected to a tree.
events.examples: on leaves decay:

events.name: On Lightning Strike
events.description: Called when lightning strikes.
events.examples:
on lightning:
	spawn a zombie at location of event-entity

events.name: On Pig Zap
events.description: Called when a pig is stroke by lightning and transformed into a zombie pigman. Cancel the event to prevent the transformation.
events.examples: on pig zap:

events.name: On Bed Enter
events.description: Called when a player starts sleeping.
events.examples: on bed enter:

events.name: On Bed Leave
events.description: Called when a player leaves a bed.
events.examples: on player leaving a bed:

events.name: On Bucket Empty
events.description: Called when a player empties a bucket. You can also use the place event with a check for water or lava.
events.examples: on bucket empty:

events.name: On Bucket fill
events.description: Called when a player fills a bucket.
events.examples: on player filling a bucket:

events.name: On Egg Throw
events.description: Called when a player throws an egg and it lands. You can just use the shoot event in most cases. However, this event allows modification of properties like the hatched entity type and the number of entities to hatch.
events.examples: on throw of an egg:

events.name: On Fishing
events.description: Called when a player fishes something. This is not of much use yet.
events.examples: on fish:

events.name: On Item Break
events.description:
Called when a player breaks their tool because its damage reached the maximum value.
This event cannot be cancelled.
events.examples: on tool break:

events.name: On Item Damage
events.description: Called when an item is damaged. Most tools are damaged by using them; armor is damaged when the wearer takes damage.
events.examples:
on item damage:
	cancel event

events.name: On Tool Change
events.description: Called whenever a player changes their held item by selecting a different slot (e.g. the keys 1-9 or the mouse wheel), not by dropping or replacing the item in the current slot.
events.examples: on player's held item change:

events.name: On Join
events.description: Called when the player joins the server. The player is already in a world when this event is called, so if you want to prevent players from joining you should prefer on connect over this event.
events.examples:
on join:
	message "Welcome on our awesome server!"
	broadcast "%player% just joined the server!"

events.name: On Connect
events.description: Called when the player connects to the server. This event is called before the player actually joins the server, so if you want to prevent players from joining you should prefer this event over on join.
events.examples:
on connect:
	player doesn't have permission "VIP"
	number of players is greater than 15
	kick the player due to "The last 5 slots are reserved for VIP players."

events.name: On Kick
events.description: Called when a player is kicked from the server. You can change the kick message or cancel the event entirely.
events.examples: on kick:

events.name: On Entity Portal
